column2: katheryn, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: What I don't understand is all the reviews about STOPPING this drug.  I guess if it's not working for you, you should stop taking it (under close medical supervision), but several of the reviewers admit it helps them, then talk about the withdrawl symptoms..  Not real sure why you stop taking a drug that works for you?  Depression is not like an infection -- you aren't "cured" by taking a few doses.  If you had high blood pressure, you wouldn't stop taking blood pressure medicine just because it came down while you were on it, would you?  I have been on this for years and it works for me. I would be a basket case without it.  I was fat to start with, so I guess I didn't notice if I gained weight after I started it. I just know I am a much better person inside my head with it than without it.

column2: nancyharr, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

column2: k_star, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Began taking this when I was 17 for depression. I had no side effects going on to the drug. Started at 75mg and worked up to 150mg. The drug is extremely hard to come off of - very, very bad withdrawl symptoms. Wish I had known it would be this bad before going on it. The withdrawl has been just as bad as my depression ever was. Watch out.

column2: SO Very Sad, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I starting taking medication for PTSD. I whole reason I tried the med was becuase I wanted to feel normal again, well it seems that all this time I've been feel like a black hole might be in part from the Effexor XR. I couldn't cry, i didn't want to be with my husband, I have been very mean to people and really just kinda blank on the inside. So after being put on a different brand I started to see the little pods from the in of the capsule in my stool. At first I thought it was just me then it happened again. I decided to stop taking the effexor and BOY was that a BAD idea. For the past week I have been have the most real feeling Nightmares ever, sweating like crazy at night, can't breathe when I try to run, Arms going numb, Pins and needle feelings in my arms, headaches, allday yuke feeling, swelling, body feeling weak all over, sleeping all the time and now I read it is only the begining, wow it could take week to complete the withdrawal feels" My Lord" I thought I was get ready to die. I went to the ER and everything. This is the WORST drug ever. I am just going natural. I pray I make it through this storm. Oh i forgot the part about the breakout all over my body like painful Acne and hands locking up.

column2: Granny Carla, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: My experience has always been a very positive one. Taking this medication leaves me feeling calm/at peace without the side effect of feeling drowsey,tired or "medicated". The only down side I have ever felt is not feeling able to cry when I felt I would normally do so. I won't say I can't cry but it is a rare occurance... as opposed to being something I would have found myself doing often, and with little reason. I am much happier and less "unreasonable" now that I am taking Effexor regularly. I am 60 years old and now only use 37.5m daily. Going without the medication is still not an option for me. I prefer to feel in control of my emotions. I'm still a very excitable, passionate person, that's me. Rather, I am not a panicked, frustrated and impatient individual.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: For the past 20 years, I have been treated for depression. Started on Prozac, then lexapro and the Effexor. Recently I had a major hypertensive issue, BP 211/110. My MD stopped the Effexor and changed me to Celexa. After only 1 week, I feel like a different person. My BP is down, more energy and basically feel like a new person. I didnt realize how bad I felt on Effexor!

column2: Krissy33, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: My doctor put me on Effexor XR after my insurance company would no longer let me have Cymbalta. I really didn't like being on it. It made me feel like a zombie-- no emotion or feelings at all. I finally got tired of feeling that way, having no energy, being tired all the time and not having any sexual desire, so I went off it. I got heart palpitations, felt dizzy and unsteady on my feet for about a week. That was definitely no fun but after that, I started feeling much better. I still take my Wellbutrin XL, and I have more energy than I have had in a long time, I'm not nearly as tired and it feels good to desire my husband again. I guess the medicine works for some people but I'm not one of them.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on this medication for several years.  My dosage is 37.5mg., it works okay, and my daughter also was prescribe this medication.  I started not sleeping well, maybe getting  three or four hours per night, so I thought it probably was the medication, so I started coming off of it, and it has been horrible, I am not going to give into the horrible side effects, but I wish my daughter never started it, and hope this drug will be pull off the market. DON'T TAKE THIS DRUG, NEVER START IT, YOU WILL BE SORRY!

column2: Lilly, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I was prescribed Effexor X-R to treat anxiety. I had hurted myself at work and I couldn't sleep and was feeling anxious. I expressed my concern about taking that type of drugs but was reassured by my doctor that they were not addictive and as soon as I wanted to stop taking them all would be fine. The first first time I tried to stop I could not get out of bed. I was feeling so ill I had to call in sick at work. I spent two days like this. I went back to see him and explained what happened and was told that after a couple days I would be fine. Wrong!! I kept taking the tablets because I could not handle feeling so sick. Even after all this still I was not told that I needed to come off them slowly . When I went back to see him, he was away so I had to see another Dr who gave me a lower dose and explained that I needed to take the lower dose for a while before I could come off them completely. I did this for 2 months and then decided that it was time to stop. Had enough. If I had known what was to come I would have never ,ever listened to my doctor and trusted him. It has been over two months now and I'm still having withdrawal symptoms. The nausea, light headed, heart racing,finding it difficult to concentrate, lack of libido, sudden feelings of sadness or anger, sweating even when it's cold, nightmares, just to name a few. I don't wish my experience with Effexor on my worst enemy.

column2: Ilpn.Tagr8@yahoo.com, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)

I want to live, so I choose to keep my liver healthy. I guess weaning myself off a little bit at a time, and I will talk to my therapist first. She may not feel it is time yet. Any suggestions on weaning myself off this medication, Effexor XL 300mg po every day,with Welbutrin 300mg po every day.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: lamoon, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: very helpful,

column2: Anony, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: NIGHTMARE - Oh, yeah, it works, and it is easy to use, but try going off of it after you have gained a ton of weight and it stops working.  You can do a long taper of weeks, months and in some cases years and you will still have horrible side effects.  A year on, and after having to go on another antidepressant because the side effects of withdrawal were so horrible, I am still not feeling right and one of the worst side effects is memory loss.  Do no take this drug.  The Glaxo Smith Kline July 2012 billion dollar settlement is the tip of the iceberg.  That settlement had to do with prescribing for teenagers and off-label uses (lies) - just wait, there will be more if people on the inside continue to whistle-blow.  Meanwhile, there is nothing to help those whose lives have been ruined by this crap. It is as difficult to get off of as heroin but I am not so sure it isn't worse.  No one really knows how or why it "works" - but it works by somehow deadening your feelings. You don't give a damn about anything.  If you ever want to go off of it, plan on tapering and then going crazy anway.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Yes Effexor is a horrible thing when missed or when trying to come off of it.  I believe that this medication has caused me to feel like I've entered menopause at age 36, NO ONE can touch my ribs or hug me or it will cause pain.  I have gained 50 lbs in the past 5 years. I'm thinking I would have been better with out it!

column2: Michele62, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I was taking the generic version of this drug for treatment of hot flashes after breast cancer treatment including chemo and tamoxifin.  Though I was concerned that I didn't need a medication for depression, I trusted my doctor.  My hot flashes were not as frequent or as intense, but I was still getting them.  Plus the other side affects including weight gain, insomnia, lack of sex drive.  After 2 years I decided I would rather have the hot flashes then the side effects, if a medication is not working for what it was prescribed for, why take it?  My mother and grandmother had hot flashes and they managed to survive without any drugs.  I agree with all the posts about going off of the drug, it has been a hellish journey, and I have done under DRs supervision.  First reduced from 75MG to 37.5, then taking every other day, now I have been off for 2 weeks.  Still experiencing dizziness, brain fog, insomnia, but I am going to hang in there as I know eventually I will comletely detox from this drug.  Please do your homework before you start taking this medication.  I have a family  member taking it for depression/anxiety and it works amazing for her, but I would really think about it before using it for hot flashes only.

column2: NikiPrch, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: This has worked great for me.I have been taking it for years.The only bad thing is the withdrawals are unbearable.I had to ween off while pregnant with both my kids & it was very hard.If for some reason you can't get your medicine & you run out its Awful!They should really warn people of the withdrawal symptoms before subscribing this medication to anyone.

column2: lucymason, 55-64 on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been taking the drug for ADD for ten years.  The other reviews about drug withdrawl are correct:  one cannot just stop, there must be a stepdown period. Times were awful when I allowed myself to run out of the drug, or there was an insurance problem with my reorder.  One or two pharmacists, sympathetic to my plight of being out of the drug and knowing the withdrawl effects, have given me enough meds for a day or two until I could get insurance paperwork straightened out.  Also, according to clinical trial and recommended usage guidelines, this drug is not normally used to treat ADD, so I've had problems getting insurance companies to cover the dosage I use for the purpose for which I use it.  I tried many drugs before settling for this, none were as effective.  The cost is down now that there is a generic formula.

column2: Guerilla3089, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Caregiver)
column9: Actually, its my wife that took it. And, everything was going along well, until "Access" of Arizona took over paying for it, then they stopped paying for it. Withdrawl is "Hell", miss one day and my wife was in Hell. Do not take this drug unless you own your own drug company!

column2: Sparky, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: The side effects and dependency of this drug are terrible. Did not seem to help with depression other than make me feel blah about everything. Tired all the time. What bothered me the most was being tired and not being interested in anything.

column2: postalmama, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on Effexor for 3 years now. It has been wonderful for me. I was having panic attacks and chest pain that I thought was a heart attack. I was yelling constantly at my children and would have fits of crying. Both my parents suffered from anxiety.  I went on this and a rescue medication. After 3 months I was able to get off the rescue med and continue on this.  I have not had any more panic attacks, or chest pain. I am more patient with my children and my husband loves that I dont get upset at little things like I used to. I am more mellow. The only down side was that it made me sleepy. That diminished after about 3 months.  I keep my pills in a pill strip so that I remember to take on every day. When I forget it gives me horrid headaches.  I know there is a generic now, but I am sticking with the name brand. If you go to the effexor website you can get a card which gives you up to 75.00 off your copay. My insurance charges me over 85.00 a month now because there is a generic, but with the copay card I pay just 10.00 a month.  I was in a horrible place before this medicaion and I dont want to go back there. I hope it continues to work for me.

column2: cscott, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this medication for 10 years.  i had to increase my dose 5 years because i would feel dizzy and light headed.  im going on my 10th year now and im having a very hard time sleeping.  i cant fall asleep at night i feels as if my thoughts will not stop.  once i do get to sleep i dont want to wake up.  i have an appointment scheduled with the doctor.  also i know right away if i miss my pill because i get light headed and feel out of my body...i get a headache as well. however these would be some of the problems i have encountered with the medication.  there are so great things about the medication.  my social anxiety has decreased and my depression isnt running my life any longer.

column2: 45-54 Female  (Patient)
column9: I was prescribed Effexor xr by me PCP. I had some improvement but it didn't seem to change much of my symptoms. I finally got in to see a Psychiatrist and he changed my medication, adjusting to lower the Effexor and increasing the new medication. The first reduction from 225mg down to 150mg caused me horrible mental distress and many other problems. The worst was extreme rage which I had to be prescribed another medication for it because I could not control my anger and could not tolerate any kind of emotions I had. Until my Psychiatrist talked to me and I understood it was the medication, I knew I was in for a hard time. It's been 3 months backing off and I'm just now at 75mg this week and have another 6 weeks to go before I can try staying off the Effexor. I think this medication can be helpful for a lot of permanent problems, but I think it's a catch all pill the PCPs prescribe because it's supposed to cover so many problems. I would recommend going to a Psychiatrist to be diagnosed and get on the proper medication the first time. I'll never let a regular doctor diagnose my mental state again. I could have easily not continued my life because I couldn't handle the withdrawals until the Psych DR. put me on the medication to keep the rage under control. Most people I talk to that have taken this medicine have gotten off it because the unbearable problems it causes.

column2: spytyr, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: john2007, 45-54 Male  (Patient)
column9: I am a post trama patient.8 sugeries,7  imobilizers,some braces for months,24/7. My whole family is gone.You have to trust me when I tell you that I have tasted hell. I was wound thighter than a mid-western tornado.I then went to my doctor who is a personal friend,internal medicine/infectious deisease,one of the smartest docs in Ca.He did not hesitate to put me on Effexor and I did not even question him. I`m real again.It has been extreamly beneficial for puting me back into society. Effexor: TRazadon for sleep,meditation,yoga,swimming,biking,workouts,ex ersize is crucial.Quit sitting around the house feeling sorry for yourself,this is just a componding scenerio,life is to short for that.Yes,its hard and I sympathize, beleive me, but its still a gift.Embrace the trails,they will make you stonger.Then suck it up and go have some fun.   Yes there are side effects. Hard to empty my bladder. No problem with erections,ever, but hard to ejaculate sometimes. A little loss of intrest in sex,it just takes someone to get me fired up about it. MY EARS are ringing! Anybody else? I have had some many MRIs in a short period of time that I thought perhaps that might be part of the ear problem.My doctors says the only way to know is to go off of effexor, but there is no way I am ready.On a final note. After reading all the Horror stories about effexor withdrawal, I asked my doc, (who has weined me off of oxicontin,percocet,zanax,alcohol)and asked him about the withdrawal, and he said " DO NOT TAKE MORE THAN 37.5 Mil out of your perscription in a two week period if not longer and then another 37.5 for two more weeks and so on. I am here to tell you all that is a SLOW process or your going to be hating freaking life if you try and go cold turkey on any med., not to mention you could have a seizure!Ahh, excuse me, but what part of talking to your doctor first before stopping this drug don`t you guys understand>?    I hope everyone finds peace in their lives. Be well.

column2: JJPet, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This was the 5th drug I have tried in the SSRI/SNRI class. When I tried Effexor, I had finally decided to consult with a psych. I had a similar reaction to all of these drugs, but my one time 18 mg. dose of Effexor was the worst; my body got the warm, tingly sensation, loss of coordination, hard to concentrate, hard to swallow, extreme head ache, body shakes, vomiting, no sleep for 2 days. I only took it one day, and three days later, my head is still pounding. Where as my internist had suggested that I stick with these symptoms for a week in hope they would get better, my psych wanted me to stop and head to the ER right away. Come to find out, not all people can matabolise the SSRI/SNRI drugs. I suggest listen to your body, and if the side effects do not feel right, please consult with psych before continuing to experiment with these drugs.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Tried celexa, paxal and gained weight rapidly - 40 lbs in 18 mos. Then tried lexapro, continued to gain 20 more lbs, eventually stopped working for me.  Effexor XR is much better, but don't try to go off suddenly.  Miserable side effects.  No weight gain on this which is a plus.  Have taken off weight gained on other antidepressants.  In winter go up to 150 mg due to lack of sunlight in northeast.  Pharmacist substituted the generic form and I didn't notice.  Awful.  After 3 days, was an emotional basketcase, crying, sensitive, not sleeping.  Overall has helped me cope with anxiety, stabalized moods and restored my cheerful personality, easier to cope with insanely intense professional job, graduate school and family ... full plate.  Works for me. Hope it helps you.

column2: Cathy, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I was taking 250mg in the morning and 75mg at night. Pfizer had been providing it to me thru "connection to care" assistance program. For that I am greatful! My doctor is very unhappy with Pfizer! It is DANGEROUS to stop without weaning off SLOWLY!!! I was given no heads-up at all that I would'nt be getting a refill. This is not how you treat people, nausea, diarhea, headache, dizzy like the world is swimming, aches all over my body and what feels like "brain-snaps" for lack of a better term. I've been living on soda crackers for a week now. I am truely grateful for the pills i was given, but I believe it to be EXTREMELY WRONG not to offer at least a weaning off process with the last supply. They (Pfizer) should be ashamed of putting countless destitute people in harms way after getting them completely dependant on their product. I will never use a Pfizer product again!Cathy-Spokane WA

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
happy, calm and dry, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Effexor has been a lifesaver for me post-menopause.  Hot flashes and night sweats were severe.  Anyone who complains about 'weaning off' should have read about the drug before taking it.  My dr. told me right up front that if I wanted to discontinue useage, I had to be prescribed something else for about 2-3 weeks.  If you're using the internet to read these postings, you should be using it to read about the side-effects of stopping usage suddenly.  Yes, they're severe and horrible.  Missing a pill is not pleasant.  But this is all part of the deal.  I can't take HRT due to cancer history in my family, and this drug has the fewest side effects of anything I researched.  Do your homework, folks, and don't take anything you don't understand fully.  I would (and do!) recommend Effexor as a solution for lots of the miseries of 'change of life'.

column2: Happy Camper, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on it for the past 7 years. I am on a very high dose = 225 MG per day (3 pills), and have been for about 5 years, however I will say my life feels incredibly normal.  I experience hardly any anxiety, nervousness, or mood swings whatsoever.  I can remain calm, cool and collected.  The ONLY downside of this drug, is forget trying to stop taking, or weaning off.  If I miss my dose by even an hour, the withdrawal symptoms are horrid.  I feel electric shocks throughout my body, I feel tired, weak and extremely irritable.  That said, if you stay on a rigid schedule of taking the exact time every day, you will feel blissful.   I have no intentions of discontinuing this drug, and my doctor has decided long term use is not harmful.  Overall this drug has been lifechanging and I am forever thankful for it.  I feel like ME again.

column2: KWW, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Changed from Prozac with Xanax to Effexor XR because Prozac was no longer containing the depression.  I like the change in my mood but continue to need Xanax for anxiety before sleep. My only complaint about Effexor (both versions) is that they will make me quite drowsy and nauseated for about 6-8 hours after ingestion.  I have learned to take them in the late afternoon or at dinner, then I can sleep or drowse through the evening, feel nauseated in the comfort of my own home and will continue with this regimen when I find a new job and go back to work.  It definitely has made me feel brighter and less depressed than Prozac. Prozac and Abilify worked equally well, but the cost of Abilify was just too high for me to continue. column2: itmatsb, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: This has been a miracle drug for me over the past 8 years with EffexorXR. When I got severely depressed I thought that no drug could help me with a terrible quality of life from 24/7 migraines that not only gave me constant pain, but prevented me from doing much of anything for the 2 and half years before.  Also having had a major stroke I was suffering from other disabilities.  A certain percentage of those suffering from chronic pain do commit suicide.  The doctor had me increase the dose and get counseling.  I never got the counseling, but 4 weeks later the depression went away--and still with the same horrible life.  Although I believe that the higher dose did help with some of my migraine pain.I have now gone off of it and switched to Pristiq because of the lack of any sex drive.  We'll see if it improves.  I have suffered from depression for many years and am committed to taking anti-depressants for the rest of my life, so the fear of getting off of it is not a concern.  I did in fact discontinue the Effexor while first switching to Savella which caused extreme nausea and never got it up to proper dose--now to the Pristiq.  If you taper off Effexor gradually, you can get off of it, unless you need it and then the depression will return. I had that experience as well years ago.I had no other side effects other than the lack of sex drive--a big one.

column9: I started taking Effexor XR due to mood fluctuations related to my hormones.  It worked wonders!!  I was on 75 mg. for years with no issues.  My insurance company then felt that need to substitute the brand name with generic (which I did not catch, so I could not figure out what was wrong with me), and I crashed-BIG TIME.  The generic is in no way like the brand name.  It took me a good 3 months to get back to where I was.  I have since increased to 150 mg. after the loss of my father, and slipping back a bit.  I did notice that if I fluctuate the times of taking it, even by a couple of hours, I will have a difficult time with anxiety/sweats.  Has anyone else ever experienced that?  When I called the doctor they automatically wanted to increase the dosage, but I am hesitant to do so because I am fearful that everytime I increase it gets me closer to being at the max I can take, and I don't want to ever get to a point where I can't take this med.  I am extremely med sensitive, and to find something that works for me is a godsend.  I know that the withdrawal is awful, but quite honestly, I never plan to stop taking this.

column2: rusmom, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years
column9: I've been on this time-released drug (and now use the generic form) for almost 4 years and have remained on the 37.5 mg doing just fine. I haven't gained weight and have lost/been able to maintain my weight unlike what I was on previously. My headaches haven't increased. I'm in my mid-60's and doing fine on the drug. After reading all the horror stories that people have posted, I have to wonder why they kept upping the drug if it wasn't working for them. There are so many types of drugs for depression, you should work with your doctor to find the one that's right for you. If your current doctor doesn't help or they're just fishing for different drugs and not monitoring you, CHANGE DOCTOR'S.

column2: jspben, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I take generic Effexor (225mgs), Wellbutrin, & Lamictal. This combo seems to work the best for me: we have tried different combos, but to not great satisfaction. I was without Effexor for a couple of days this summer. It was an immediate & dramatic withdrawal. It seemed as if I was experiencing bursts of "electrical activity" in my head, I was very dizzy, all I could hear was a continuous "white noise" that increased with my vertigo. So, I don't plan to go off it any time soon. If I ever have to stop taking it, I will insist on constant monitoring, since I seem to be very sensitive to the drug.

Always tired and feel like I have the flu.  Terrible dry mouth.  I'm due to increase the dosage in three days, but I think I wil call the doctor and get off of it. column2: anonymous, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have fought with depression and anxiety for years.  I have tried 8 diff meds and effexor is just the most helpful for me.  I am on 150mg of xr and it has made me human again.  I do experience trouble finding words sometimes, night sweats, tremors in the mornings... but not to the point that it bothers me much.  I have taken this in the past and coming off of it is horrible.  The brain "zaps" are annoying and the feeling of being out of my mind was awful for a few weeks.  I am well aware of all of that now that I am taking the meds again.  I tried a few others after coming off effexor xr and they just didn't benefit me the same way.  So don't fear that this drug will ruin your life.  It has helped me get mine back.  Know what to expect when you come off of it.  Follow your doctor's advice for stopping it.  Or just stay on it!  I plan to for a while.  For more positives, I have not lost my sexual drive at all.  I have also lost 20lbs in the 6 months I have been on it with little effort.  My appetite just isn't nearly as strong as before taking this.  And best, no more intrusive thoughts and crying episodes!

column2: OpinionCounts, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I was going through some very bad things at work,no matter what I did things weren't helping. I then was experiencing mood swings, extreme hot flashes, night sweats, joint pains, crying, etc..talking w/my doc it was said to be depression and put me on this & didn't work, tried other things out there & didn't work & then back to this @ 175mg/day. To date no results, decided to see ob/gyn, well...the ob/gyn put me on estradiol (I had my uterus removed 11 yrs ago due to endometriotris)I'm feeling great! NOT DEPRESSION!!!It's change of life!!! I should've gotten a second opinion a long time ago instead of all this; very weird dreams, extreme weight gain with no matter what I did, still mood swings, with horrible hot flashes, night sweats, etc. I did try cutting cold turkey...don't it's horrible experience!!! I started going every other day then every two, then every three and so on...this worked!!! I advise everyone getting a second opinion before going on any antidepressants unless it's for a fact it's depression!!!! I don't put the sole blame on the med though, it's hugely my doc not listening & a part me not getting a second opinion and putting my faith & belief in just one person I thought I could!!!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I Took this eight months after my son was born for post partum anxiety and panic attacks. Within one week of 37.5 I felt better and another week of 75 mgs I was on the road back to my old self. Six months into it and I went back down to the lowest dose and six months later I stopped taking it. It was a sluggish light- headed four days, but other than that it gave me a wonderful year with my son and gave ms back the confidence to deal with my anxiety on an appropriate level. Thank god for this drug.

column2: EffexorXR victim , 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I consider this the Devil's drug. This drug has been the worst thing that's happened to me. I've been on it for approximately 5-6 years at 300mg daily. When starting, no problems at all. After the effective period (which has been so long ago, i dont even remember when it stopped working) ended and i became so uncontrollably sick from the withdraws I started reading on here about what i was going thru. I was amazed how many people were reporting the EXACT same things i was going through, but more so the fact that my dr told me NOTHING about any of it! Since then I have literally been too afraid to try to stop again because of the withdraws. This drug is so highly addictive it is unreal. Until the last month, I've taken the medication with no benefits with the sole reason being the fear of withdraw symptoms. The last month, however, My depression has escalated and feel that I can no longer fear the withdraw and still be this miserable. I have a new prescription (cylexa I believe) and will be starting in the next day or so.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I've been taking Effexor for 6 years, now, and from the first day starting at 37.5 through now at 150, I told the Dr that "I never want to stop taking this."  It put me on an even keel, and takes away the "fretting" about what used to send me into a black abyss every day.  Kind of like just sweeping everything under the rug - I'm okay with that; I guess I'm happy just avoiding the problem.  The ONLY problem I have (and my Dr tells me that it is a very rare side effect) is that I can easily sleep 15 to 17 hours a day.  And, no, it isn't the depression causing that because I have tried switching to Wellbutrin which eliminated the sleeping problem.  But I am going to have to go back to Effexor because life just sucks too much on Wellbutrin - I get so angry....

column2: franny, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Effexor is the only antidepressant that works for me. I have tried celexa, zoloft, wellbutrin and always return. It is so important to taper SLOWLY if coming off. I thought I was in control of my depression, could get by without medication,and with my DR's supervision, tapered for 2 months to get off 75 mg daily. Going slowly, side effects are minimal. Don't even think about quitting quickly.We halved the dosage for 3 weeks, 1/2 again for 3 weeks, etc. As for weight gain, I have lost 5 lbs and have decreased appetite. It hasn't helped with hot flashes, I'm 54 and in menopause. Sometimes I have weird dreams, but overall I'm happy with the med. It got me out of my deep, dark hole and I feel like myself again. I was off for 3 months, but am back on- feeling good.

column2: jerseygirl164, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I was started on this drug after the death of my husband. s a nurse i was always adverse to these kinds of medications, BUT I was so depressed and a high level of anxiety  with suicidal thoughts,I was willing to try anything. Started on the lowest dose...3 years later at 300mg a day I had enough...this drug alters your ability  to make to think straight and make  sound judgements, beside the 65 pounds I gained. There is NO warning that this drug can impair your thinking process. If I could sue this company for the hell my life became while on this drug I would !! Weened off it and thankfully did not have problems that I read others here did.  I would NOT recommend this drug to anyone. My doctor was very upset about the side effects I experienced.

column2: 75 or over Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
myfirstpost, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was extremely excited to take Effexor XR. I first came on WebMD and read all of the amazing reviews of how people love this product. I suffer from panic attacks, usually brought on my situations or events. I didn't have general anxiety and a Xanax was usually how I would treat an attack.  But since my attacks were becoming slightly frequent the doctor prescribed me Effexor XR 75mg.  I took my first pill after breakfast and within 2 hours I started too feel like a zombie. I also started to exhibit signs of an anxiety attack (sweaty palms, hot/cold, nausea)But I was able to press on, went into day two, same thing, trouble sleeping, overall miserable. So I started reading online, most people were starting off at 37.5mg. not 75mg. so on the 3rd day I put a call into the doctor to find out what he thought, because obviously something wasn't right with this prescription.  Within 2 hrs of being awake I felt a panic attack starting, so I took .5mg of Xanax hoping that would calm me down.  Unfortunately the panic attack was full blown, and was one of the worst attacks I have had in over 10 years.  I was on the verge of calling 911 to help get me sedated but luckily I had family who helped sedate me and get me to sleep.  Today is the 2nd day without this medication, and again I woke up with the same general anxiety and uneasy feeling I had yesterday. All in all, this medication is not for everyone. The side effects are very real, and very strong. I was brought up around anxiety in my family and am very knowledge on what triggers my attacks and how to handle them accordingly.  What I am experiencing because of this Effexor XR is not horrible and beyond anything I have dealt with before.  I strongly suggest that you use this with caution and I hope that if you read this and it helps you I have done my job. This is my first review on here and I just felt the need to share how horrible my experience was with this medication. I would not ever take this again.

column2: kiaweron, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Effexor for 7 years.  It helped with my depression for several years, but being on this drug long term caused a multitude of physical problems. In addition to confusion, sexual dysfunction, constipation, constant gas, ringing in my ears, and memory problems, in the last year I have developed severe stomach problems, weird and frightening dreams, twitching of my legs, arms and hands. I weaned myself off this drug for 2 weeks, then went cold turkey 3 weeks ago when I realized my stomach problems were improving since I stopped taking Effexor.  Right now I fight unexpected feelings of irritablility on and off all day, sadness, and frustration, but I can eat anything I want, no more heartburn or indigestion.  My sex life is back, and I have more energy. I am trying to be aware of my moods and if I feel that I need medication again, it will not be Effexor.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I know that a lot of people say they have had problems coming off this medication but that is not always the case.  If you carefully follow your doctor's instructions there are a number of things you can do to make the transition quite manageable (including decreasing the dose very slowly and adding a drug like Prozac).  Never stop taking Effexor without your doctor's instructions but don't be frightened away from a medication that may help your life feel worth living again.  I have been taking 300mg/day Effexor for over a year now and it is the very best thing that has helped me manage my depression.  I have always followed my Doctor's instructions and have not had any problems with the medication.  I do have to be very careful not to miss a dose though or I experience a lot of dizziness and anxiety.  I have been treated for severe depressive disorder for about 6 years and have taken a number of different different medications as part of my treatment (including Prozac, Wellbutrin, and Lamictal).  I was only getting minimal benefit from depression medications when my PCP was prescribing them but since I started seeing a psychiatrist and she put me on Effexor I have been managing so so so much better (even when my Mom died of cancer last year).  I highly recommend getting a psychiatrist and talking with them about all the pros and cons if you are considering taking Effexor.

column2: Chiefbear2, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Does anyone have experience or info re memory loss with this med?  I feel that it was poor choice for me as my depression has historically had significant anxiety component with inability to be still, severe insomnia (partially work hours related, partially just me) When I started Effexor, I almost immediately started losing ability to pay attention to what I was doing, seeing, hearing etc.  Huge memory gaps still exist although I stopped taking it about a month ago.  Plain SSRIs used to work, and I have restarted Sertraline which I'd taken successfully before.  I was so unaware of the effect, I didn't even know I should be calling psychiatrist or PCP.  After about a year, it got so bad, I couldn't perform my work and have been underemployed, then finally unemployed.  Will the lost memory come back? (new ones are f0roming quite well now

column2: SB, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: After being diagnosed with chronic deppression, I began treatment with other anti-depressants, but results were inconsistent and temporary. I quit taking meds for about a year, but depression returned. Began taking Effexor; first at lowest dose, gradually raising to 150. Yes, there are some side effects; trouble sleeping (I take it in the morning now), some weight gain (not all due to the drug I'm sure), and if I forget to take a dose, I feel dizzy (Use a weekly pill box and keep some in your purse or at work just in case). I can live with those relatively minor side effects. I can't live with the constant darkness and occasional suicidal thoughts I had before. I've been taking this medication for years, recently with the addition of Wellbutrin. I will continue taking this medication as long as I need to. If, for some reason, I needed to quit taking it I'd work with my doctor to gradually lower the daily dose ... not just skip doses or quit taking them.

column2: Bailey, 55-64 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had severe Fibromyalgia for about 15 years but not diagnosed until 6 years ago.  Since then I have been taking Gabapentin 600mg 3 x a day, Skelaxin 800mg 3 x a day as well as Dermerol 50mg at least 3 x a day, but usually 5 to 6 times a day  There was some relief but not much and was unable to sleep on my left side at all due to the severe pain in my hip and leg.  Added Elavil 75mg to help with sleeping which did help however the side effect of an increased desire for sweets eventually became too much to deal with.  As I was eating one thing, I was thinking about what to have next.  With my height at 4' 10'' my weight ballooned up to 140 lbs I was very uncomfortable, so I stopped taking it.  My pain was to the point I could barely function and I became severely depressed, fatigued and my pain was off the charts, at least as far as I was concerned.  After researching Cymbalta and Effexor I talked with my doctor and decided to give the Effexor xr 75mg a try.  I have been on it for 3 months now and I am very pleased with the results.  My depression has all but abated, I have my "bad" days one or two days a week mainly fatigue but not as bad as it was.  But more importantly is my PAIN IS SO MUCH BETTER!  I am hoping to get off of the Gabapentin and Skelaxin as well as weaning off of the Demerol.  I'm finding that I don't need it as much as before.  As long as it continues to work for me I have no issue with staying on it.  I do have some side effects, I always have a slight headache but I can deal with it, if it gets too bad then I take some Ibuprofen.  The most annoying side effect is the sweating, I live in the Desert Southwest where the temps often run 110 degrees in the summer months.  I'd rather sweat than be in pain.  The insomnia was the worst, however I've found that if I take in the morning that seems to work for me.

column2: J, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Horrible, horrible side effects if you decide to come off it. I've been on it aprox 6 yrs. Now coming off of it. I felt for the last several yrs I was living in a fog, just realized the last yr it was the effexor xr. I couldn't concentrate, some days couldn't get the words out I wanted to say and tired most of the time. Best way to describe it would be living in a numb state...not depressed, but not anything, just living live a zombie.  I've been reducing dosage for the last two mths. Usually very, very passive, but first day on reduced (from 75 to 37) I was so angry I thru a bottle and put a hole in the wall. My 2nd day off it completly(today) is a nightmare! Now very ANGRY & Mean! Yelled at my elderly mom yesterday and mad at everything. Today, I'm mad one second,crying the next. Minor brain zaps,minor because I withdrew slowly, was down to aprox 15 mg when I stopped completly. For anyone contemplating taking this, PLEASE research it in detail. If you do an internet search you will see that I am one of many going thru the hell of withdrawals on this awful medicine. Dr's DO NOT tell you what this is like. I wouldn't wish this feeling on anyone...well maybe the CEO of the drug company that makes this horrible stuff!

column2: Feeling better, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was prescribed this med for menopausaul symptoms. Let me begin by saying that I am not a typical case. Six years ago at the young age of 28, I become post-menopausal do to surgically removing ovarian tumors. Because of this, I do not have hot flashes. My symptoms are extremely slow metabalism and low libido. So my doctor gave me Effexor in the smallest dose to hopefully combat these symptoms. Although I read all of the reviews here before taking it, everyone reacts differently so I decided to try it. I took 1 pill Sunday night. Within an hour my heart began to race. I did not sleep all night, and went to work the next day. My eyes were bugged out and I was wired, I could have ran a marathon! By 2:00pm I started to come down, my heart stopped racing but I was still wired. I did not take another dose Mon. evening, and I slept well. However, I woke up Tues. with a horrible headache. Within 15 minutes the diarehea started and then immediately the vomitting. I couldn't even keep down water. After vomitting 15 times, I had to call off work and was able to go back to sleep. I slept over 14 hours that day and finally kept down soup at 4:00pm. Another full night of sleep, Wed. I was a little groggy and Thurs. I felt like myself. All of this was only with ONE DOSE and the minimum dosage at that! Although everyone reacts differently, please research this well and have someone available who can monitor you and help you if you need it. This is very potent stuff. Good Luck.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: My husband lost his job and we Couldn't afford $150.00 a month so I went to the dr and was put on a cheaper but just as effective medicine. I was not told about all the wicked withdrawal side effects. I took effexor 150mg for 1 year and came off of it cold turkey to start my new med. Never again will I do this. I actually thought I was having a nervous breakdown! The constant crying I could handle but when the dizziness and the brain zaps started it really scared me. I went to a doctor who told me that I should have been weaned off of that one and it will take 2 to 3 weeks for the withdrawal symptoms to ease. Now I have to take Klonopine for a few weeks to help with the symptoms but I will have to be weaned off of that also!!! People needs to be aware of what they are taking including the withdrawal symptoms and some physicians fail to explain things to them like they should!!!!

column2: jesses girl 11, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have taken Effexor XR for almost ten years.  It has caused a few strange things-sweating is more prominent as are the vivid dreams.  Increased blood pressure/heart rate. The side effects are WORSE than taking the drug.  They finally realized this and put me back on it.  It has truly helped me, despite the negative parts-its been a life saver for me.There are some of us who will need anti-depressants once, some who need them intermittently, and some who need them forever. column9: Started taking this med about 6 years ago now for depression and anxiety after celexa went generic and was no longer effective for me. I take 150mg/day. Is pretty effective although some days I feel like a need a larger dose. I don't really notice any side effects when I take it correctly but like other writers have mentioned DO NOT miss a dose or withdrawl kicks in immediately. I ran out once and missed 2 days and thought I had the flu or mono for a week. I can always tell immediatly if I've forgotten to take my medicine within a about 4 hours.Remember not every medication works for every person. Also when 37.5mg may be effective for one person another may need 150mg to be effective. Do not just assume because the doctor started you out on one dose that this will work for you. Keep in close contact with your doctor so that adjustments can be made if one dose isn't working for you. I do agree though that family doctors and internists should not be allowed to prescribe psychiatric medications without scheduling psychiatrist followup with their patients first. I know my doctor wrote me the rx when I asked and then just keeps renewing it. Not a good idea.

column9: During a VERY trying time in my life, and diagnosed with fibromyagia, I was put on 35 mg, and increased to 75. Ins only paid for generic a few months ago, and I felt different. I started having more ANXIETY panic attacks. I started feeling more depressed. Now that I am in a better emotional state, I went from 150 to 75mg. This alone seemed to help me, as I am having LESS panic attacks, and don't feel as tired. I want to go completely off of it now, but I fear The "Brain Ticks" feeling (I get when I miss a pill). I also am going to the bathroom more regularly now. To sum it up, at first, the benefits were so helpful, now the negatives out way them. I would definately recommend a "diary" be kept for long-term use of this med! Even if you've been taking it for years, the effects CHANGE!

column2: boraborabound, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: After 6 months of continuous, severely debilitating anxiety, and of trying every other drug and treatment, I finally agreed to go back on Effexor.  I knew what I was getting into 'cause I had gone through it all about 5 years earlier. I have gained 25 un-needed lbs. although I am very careful of how much I eat.  I am sleepy during the day, to the point of falling asleep while driving.  I am in wonderful shape emotionally, but dread the day I decide to wean off of it once again.  I went through the brain zaps, dizziness and self-torture of "cold turkey" last time, and at least my doctor and I know what to do this time.  My doctor did not know about the withdrawal problems the first time... I had to educate him and tell him about weaning off gradually.  This med is wonderful, and saved my life, literally.  Some day I will again get off of it... the right way, and try to lose the extra weight.  In the meantime, I am fat but happy!

column2: luv2bhappy, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I started on this medication (75mg)to try to ease the effects of hot flashes after breast cancer.  It doesn't do a miracle job, but it lessens it a bit.  I do warn anyone NOT to stop this medication without a DR's help.  You must wean yourself off of it.  I use mail order prescriptions, and due to a mix-up at the provider, and the holidays I was off this medication "cold turkey" for 8 days.  I felt like my brain had a severe "short circuit", sometimes down to my feet and hands.  I was dizzy and forgetful to the point of being 'spacy".  I am crying alot, and really have thoughts that nobody cares for me and they'd be better off if I was gone.  Prior to being on this drug I had not thoughts of being worthless.  I do know that it's only the lack of medication that is causing this.  I did receive my prescription today and started the drug again.  However, it is going to take a bit to "get back in my system".  I am seriously thinking about getting with my doctor to stop this medication safely.  It scares me.

column2: LW Not Paronoid, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: The med worked fast (within about 2 weeks)to help me in a dark time of depression, anxiety, & ptsd, but now that I am better (after 4 months)I began to reduce my dosage over 1 month from 150mg per day to zero per day, I am having terrible withdrawals.  Even if I forgot to take 1 dosage I would have terrible dreams and what feels like my brain is short circuiting. After doing internet research to see if anyone else out there was experiencing similiar symptons as me, I found out many described the exact symptoms as I..now I know they are withdrawal symptoms.  At least I am relieved to know that what I thought may be mini strokes is being referred to as "brain Shevers". When I tried to explain to my family, they thought I needed to go back to taking the effexor because they thought I was being paronoid.

column2: kyzrsosay, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Over the course of 10 years or so, I have struggled with mild depression and anxiety.  I was originally prescribed Celexa, Lexapro (which I hated, although I know many others who swear by it), and EffexorXR with Effexor being simultaneously the most effective yet most difficult to adjust to.  Withdraw was annoying but not unbearable.  I found the worse symptoms occur from not being properly titrated.  My doctor started me on 150mg after being off of the drug for 2 years.  I'm now one week into the treatment and have severe diarrhea, no appetite at all, and have hardly slept a good nights sleep in a week.  Please don't be discouraged by this drug by my review, it certainly improved my quality of life when prescribed properly. However Effexor when not properly prescribed can make a patient non-compliant and unwilling to seek much needed treatment due to these uncomfortable side effects.  To all suffering from depression and anxiety out there, I wish you all the best and i hope my review was helpful.

column2: malyn, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I wanted to tell other people that I think there is a way to get off this drug. I'll tell you what I am doing that seems to lessen the withdrawal effect. First get a notepad because you are going to want to write everything down because you will be decreasing your dosages. Your effexor XR capsule will have little white beads inside of it. Depending on your dosage, that is how many beads are in it. My dose is 75 mg, so I have 75 little white beads in it. Step 2 is to get a small dark colored bowl and a pencil. Next wiggle "cap" off the capsule. This is the shorter end of the capsule. Once you have it off then set it to the side. Now you will see that there are the tiny little white beads inside. Do not dump the entire content of beads into the dark colored bowl! (I use the dark colored bowl since it's easier to spot and count the beads). Now while holding the capsule, tip it slightly to loosen the beads up and grab your pencil. With the pencil tip, easily scrape the beads out one at a time if you can. Always check your bowl and COUNT the white beads because you need to be exact. EVERY DAY YOU WILL REDUCE YOUR DOSAGE BY 5 WHITE BEADS! DON'T REDUCE BY ANYMORE THAN THAT OR YOU WILL DEFINITELY EXPERIENCE WITHDRAWAL SYMPTOMS! Once you remove 5 beads from the capsule, screw the top "cap" on snug. You will have to wiggle it back on. Discard the beads preferably in an old medicine bottle with a child-proof cap. Take the capsule with at least a bottle of water to wash down and WITH food. Do not take with juice because I heard it can increase the effects of medications. So far I have reduced by Effexor dosage from 75 mg to 40mg with no side effects. I am really starting to feel like I am getting my personality back! Plus I have dropped a few pounds since my body is feeling alive again. I recommend this method to anyone wanting to get off this Effexor nightmare. Do not stop cold turkey or you'll be like a person experiencing a heroin withdrawal and that's not a pretty sight!

column9: So far I have reduced by Effexor dosage from 75 mg to 40mg with no side effects. I am really starting to feel like I am getting my personality back! Plus I have dropped a few pounds since my body is feeling alive again. I recommend this method to anyone wanting to get off this Effexor nightmare. Anti-depressants are the worst meds ever developed. Especially since doctors hand them out like candy. Do not stop taking Effexor without sloooowly reducing your beads! Otherwise you'll be like someone going through a heroin withdrawal and that's not a pretty sight! It might seem like it will take forever but you will get off this beast!

column2: Jojo, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've been skeptical for last 2 yrs on taking any anti-anxiety medication, but finally due to the worsening of my physical symptoms (panic attacks and shortness of breath in middle of the night, insomnia, high blood pressure), my doctor has prescribed what I refer to as the "happy pill/miracle drug".  My first experience of taking this drug - within two hours of taking my first dose of 37.5 mg - I had blurred vision, fatigue and a "fogginess sensation".  Same night, I had experienced insomnia, extreme night sweats and flue-like symptoms.   Above side effects has since subsided.  It's now been three weeks on same daily dosage, and am now re-experiencing blurred vision again and ringing in my ears.  As for my panic attacks and other symptoms at night, it's gone.  I'm currently on meds for HBP, and is closely monitored.  Pros-"It definitely works - no more anxiety:)  You get a good night rest.  Live a normal life again".  Cons-"What price do you have to pay?  Does the side effects of this drug really worth  living with?  Are the withdrawal symptoms really worse than what I was going thru b4 this "wonder drug"?  What are the long-term effects on your liver and other internal organs?  Is it really worth it?  I'm still debating on whether to continue Effexor or not since I have no intention of increasing my current dosage for obvious reasons.  I may go back to herb medicine since I never experienced any side effects as indicated above and no withdrawal symptoms.  **In conclusion, Efferol does relieve anxiety symptoms, and I have felt the immediate effects within two weeks of taking it. As for continuing on taking it, we'll have to see if there's any other alternate methods-Natual products, healthy diet, meditation and relaxation techniques, acupuncture and exercise...

column9: I was extremely depressed and had horrible anxiety attacks when I was first prescribed this medication 5 years ago. It helped a great deal and the benefits of the drug outweighed the negatives. The negatives for me were extreme exhaustion and lack of ability to get up and do social things like I used to. I did continue to force myself to going out with my friends and became used to living with the exhaustion. Tho it was always nagging part of my life. Sleeping 11 hours + a night and still being tired. Not to mention the vivid dreams and drenching night sweats (not just sweat, but clothes are wet and sheets are wet to visible point - like an absorbed puddle almost).After 5 years I've decided to go off the medication, I feel my life is in a much better place and I'd like to try life drug free. Also, at this time, the negatives were outweighing the positives. I've been on a dose of Effexor XR 150 for 5 years. I've been weaning off for a full 5 weeks under the supervision of a psychiatrist that I see once a week. It went well at first but as I'm approaching my 3rd week on a quarter does (37.5) I've become really sick. Terrible headaches every day, vomiting, dizziness, motion sickness...its really debilitating and I'm now out of sick days for work. Aside from the actual physical sickness, I'm also having high anxiety and could burst into tears at any point. It could be a great joy or pretty much any emotion/feeling that triggers this. I wish I knew what I was getting into. I don't regret my 5 years on the drug and the way it helped me get my life back in order - but I was not prepared for the terrible withdraws from this drug.

column2: mrm, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Effexor XR has worked the best for me out of Paxil and Lexapro. I have been on Effexor for almost 10 yrs now. Now the drawbacks...missing one to two doses causes me to feel weepy, irritable, have stomach cramps and brain zaps. It's so important to take this med consistantly.  I have decided to come off my meds because I have absolutely lost my libido and almost my marriage! I exercise regularly, but have gained 15 pounds since I uped my meds to 150mg. ( I have taken 75mg for most of my yrs on effexor) My family doctor is going to ween me off slowly to help with the dreadful side effects. My advice is to take this med if you suffer with panic disorder and need a long term fix because it works wonders. I hope to manage w/out it...

column9: I've been on Effexor XR Caps for 8 years.I went from Wellbutrin that stopped working to this one. It has worked well for these years. REading any reviews can scare a person about any drug.  I take mine first thing in the morning. I was warned not to take it later than noon because of possible insomnia.  My diagnosis ranges from depression to "change of life" issues, as well as ADHD.I've been very fortunate to be able to obtain this medication and follow the dosing exactly 75 mg for me. column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
KATT,  Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I was given Prozac in 1997 for treatment of depression/anxiety. I stayed on it for approx 10 years and gained 40lbs. I took effexor for 3 years, gained more weight, slept,sweat, and had no sex drive. That was nothing! Coming off of it was an absolute nightmare. I ended up in the hospital. I was told my Dr. she DOES NOT perscribe it anymore because she can't get people off of it. I came off of it with a Dr. help (A PDoc not a family practitioner) over a years time. I have been off of it & on nothing for 3 years and I have lost ALL the weight and feel good. Please work with a Doctor and come off slowly. DO NOT come off of it alone or any SSRI or SRNI work with your doctor. If you need it stay on it! Also, see a therapist! Talk therapy works a pill will NOT solve it all. I recommend a book by Dr.David Burnes-Feel Good. Cognitive Behavior Therapy is amazing.

column2: Love, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Effexor for aproximately 1 1/2 years. At first I felt it was a God send because of the death of my best friend and horrible other losses and demanding job not letting up! I found I was tired than normal, I put on weight and had not near the same drive and motivation as normal. I am usually a top performer in sales and care very much about excellence and all the sudden, when you are use to an A performance C was just fine. Some of that was ok, I guess I needed a break from Ms. over achiever however, sleeping to much was affecting my life allot. I could just go to work come home and sleep and sometimes if I did not take a nap in the day I would be sick. Coming off the drug is the worst physical side affects I have ever experienced and I had no idea how long it will last. I am attempting to ween myself off and I am having horrible sweats, dizziness nause and horrible night mares. If you try to go off cold turkey it is so much worse than the stomach flu, you wish you were dead! I wish I had been given other choices and had known that this was an addictive drug. If I had it to do over I would have much rather endured the weeping and heart ache than the tremendous ordeal and physical side effects this has been! I cannot wait till this is entirely out of my body! Please if there is another non addictive drug take that! This is horrible!!! If you have to get up and work your life will be hell untill this has been cleansed entirely from your system. I am not sure how long that process takes but would love to hear a report of someone who made it off and how long it took them to ween from the drug and the side effects leaving.

column2: Rita, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: You know what, I absolutely loved this drug. I have tried several antidepressants for my anxiety disorder and this one seems to work the best for me. After the withdrawal wore away is when I felt that I needed something yet to help control my anxiety. I am now on the 3rd drug and am almost ready to tell my doctor that I'd rather be back on Effexor XR again. Only one other downfall other than the withdrawal symptoms is it causes low libido. We have to work on that one.

column2: AmyC, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I was prescribed Effexor for Generalized Anxiety Disorder.  I had pretty much tried all the other ones and nothing worked, I couldn't tell I was taking anything and I would just stop taking them abrubtly and nothing happened.  HOWEVER,  when I was prescribed Effexor, after the first few days I started having nightmares, I mean CRAZY nightmares and during the day I felt like I was in a fog.  It was the scariest feeling ever.  So I just stopped taking them. WHEW!! That's when I really thought I was losing my mind.  I called my DR but he never got back with me.  (It was a new DR)  So I got on the internet and read about it and I found all these other horror stories exactly like mine.  And you can NOT just stop taking them so as bad as I hated to I had to start back up and wean myself off them.  I take Klonopin now and it works awesome.  However,  it's not for depression, only anxiety so if you have depression you will need something with it.  I just wanted to tell my experience about Effexor,  I'm glad it helps some people, just be careful and ask a lot of questions to your DR ahead of time!!

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month
MW, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I experienced HORRIBLE anxiety after my first child was born, to the point that I could not sleep or care for my baby.  I hated life and asked my husband if we could give our child up for adoption.  I knew something was seriously wrong, so I went to the doctor.  They put me on Zoloft, but it didn't work and I didn't have several weeks to wait and see if it would work.  I went back to the doctor, and they put me on Effexor XR.  It started working within a few days and significantly increased the quality of my life.  I could take care of my baby again and began sleeping better and enjoying life again.  The only side effect I noticed was strange dreams, but that was a small price to pay for feeling human again.  I was on it for about a year and decided to wean off it after finding out that I am pregnant again.  I was on a dose of 75mg/day, and it took me about two and a half weeks to wean off Effexor completely.  The only side effect of weaning off was that my head felt "floaty" - I joked with my husband that I felt like a bobblehead.  I am starting to feel more anxiety again and may go back on it if it is safe to use during pregnancy.  I know Effexor is not for everyone, but it truly has been a miracle drug for me.

column2: Tess_du_ville, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on Effexor XR, 150 mg. for 9 years and find it very helpful as a depression aid. I had to give up my job in L.A. and move to Las Vegas when my husband was transferred in 2000; this was a monumental step for me, causing great headaches and depression. Once when I went on a five-day cruise, I forgot to take this medication and experienced withdrawal involving nausea and stomach aches; that reaction frightened me, and I am very cautious now not to forget the appropriate amount of Effexor XR when I travel. I have had absolutely no negative side effects other than the one mentioned above. Many unhappy experiences have occurred in my life since 2000, but Effexor XR has helped me considerably, and I wouldn't want to change to another anti-depression medication. In fact, my doctor asked if I wanted to try Pristiq, a newer anti-depression drug; I did experience it for two or three weeks, and it was not a good or effective medication. I was teary and emotionally upset for the duration of the drug use. I returned to Effexor XR and felt completely better and more satisfied immediately.The only drawback is the expense of Effexor XR; I run out of insurance in June, and it costs me around $400 for a 90-count the rest of the year; however, I have to continue with it because it does the job.

jlsmiley22, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I was prescribed 75mg. of Effexor SR for depression due to side effects of taking interferon and ribaviran treatment for hep c treatment from June of 09.  I was supposed to be on it until Sept. 2010, but due to the high cost and the fact that I took my last treatment at the end of March of this year, I decided to stop taking it.  I read a lot of blogs regarding the brain shivers, insomnia, etc. and was pretty apprehensive about going "cold turkey", but decided that it couldn't be any worse than kicking a heroin habit.  It has been almost 2 weeks now and the first week I found myself being very emotional, crying for no reason, brain shivers, insomnia, etc. It was uncomfortable but not as bad as others have experienced.  I'm doing pretty well this week, still have the brain shivers, but they're not as frequent or as severe.  I would recommend reading the experiences of others BEFORE taking Effexor XR.  I have taken Zoloft in the past, but did not experience any withdrawal problems with it.

column2: morningglory1280, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I was originally put on 75 mg, and within 6 months I began to experience the same symptoms that caused me to go on this medicine to begin with. My doctor increased the dosage to 150 mg. This was where all went wrong.The symptoms of needing an increase in dosage are similar to the symptoms of needing a decrease. I went the wrong way. For nearly 2 years I stayed on 150 mg- my attention span barely existed, my short-term memory was terrible, and I felt as if I was constantly in a fog-- much like the original depression. In an attempt to rid myself of all medicines, I quite cold turkey for about a week. The same withdrawal symptoms that everyone talks about- the brain "zaps", dizziness, headaches, shaking, etc.- consumed me. What I did next saved my life in many ways. I went to ANOTHER doctor who put me on 37.5 mg. I began to feel stable for once. I felt as if I was back again; I felt like me. I have been on 37.5 mg now for a while, and all is well. I have no outbursts, no lows, and even no manic states. I truly believe that people's many bad experiences with Effexor are due to over-medication.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have just renewed my script for my second month of 37.5 mg. I have lived with severe anxiety my whole life. The benefits of this medication in the past 5 weeks are AMAZING! I do have a few concerns, I don't care for the daily left temple headache that comes and goes through out the day; but not stressing about everything all the time makes me happier than I have ever been! The other two side effects I have are that it is NEARLY IMPOSSIBLE to enjoy sex or orgasm anymore and some nights I wake (3-5 am) and have HORRIBLE episodes of anxiety to the point of a panic attack much worse than before I started taking the Effexor.  I thought this medication was "constant". Is there a "low time" with this medication?? No one else has commented on this in any other post so maybe it's just me? I am very worried about increasing or weaning from this medication per all the reviews here but I am SO COMPLETELY HAPPY during the day without all the looping crazy thoughts in the back of my mind that have plagued my life prior to the Effexor XR. Lastly, I also take Adderall for ADD, I am glad I talked to the Pharmacist before starting the Effexor, he told me that I needed to space the two medications a minimum of 2 hours apart every morning or I would not be happy with the side effects.

But then when I was down to nothing the pain began....the nausea, vomiting, "brain zaps", tingling in my arms and legs, and feeling not in control of my emotions became too much to bear. I started lashing out at my husband and one night it got so bad I tried to committ suicide! I am in the process of finding other alternatives to control these symptoms...Valerian root and ginger tea have helped me the most!!I think doctors should warn of the pain and problems this drug has when one is trying to come off of it.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: WARNING!!! What ever you do Do not take Effexor without reading the effects you will have when you want to come off it...#1 The effects you will live with when coming off this drug are not worth it....I weaned off the best way possible going from 150mg to 107 to 75 and finally to 37.5 over a couple months and still had to live with the worst side effects / withdraw symptoms you could imagine for months!!  You dont get warnings on this before taking this drug.  Look/google it up and read the horror stories before you decide to take this drug... You will be sooooo sick no matter what when you try to get off this drug.....tons of people can not get off because of how bad the withdrawl is.  You just can not function...You are to ill to move, you get so dizzy you vomit, you get weird brain zapping feelings, you cant concentrate, I was afraid to drive it was so bad and so on... #2 Now being off this drug and the side effects slowing  I feel so alive, motivated, happy,I can finally poop like normal and sex !! Being on Effexor you might as well forget sex... I forgot how fun it was (lol). I had no idea what this drug did to me, looking back just a month later and how I feel now,,,,Was I a walking zombie?...I dont know but Im so happy to be off it....I would not recommend Effexor to anyone!!! Personally I will stick to prozac...... Good luck to all....

column2: Ethomas99, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: If you're reading reviews because you are considering taking Effexor, PLEASE READ THIS. I hope this medication gets taken off the market. I was put on 37.5 mg in a psychiatric ward while I was suffering extreme depression from drug abuse and psychosis in 2006. It helped a lot. My brain was so imbalanced from my drug use that at the time, I needed medication. However, the initial euphoric reaction I had to it faded, and my quack doctor increased my dosage more and more. By 2008 I was on 300 mg, the maximum dose. I stayed on it, out of fear. Why was I afraid? Because missing a dose even by a matter of hours made me experience severe withdrawal. In the beginning, I dropped 30 pounds in 3 months, but then gained it all back slowly and no matter how healthy I ate or how often I excersised, I couldn't lose weight. My hair also stopped growing. Finally with enough support from family and friends, I tapered down. It's taken almost 2 years to go from 300 to 75 mg. Each time I taper, I have debilitating withdrawal. Nausea, sweating, anxiety, mood swings, body aches, brain zaps (feels like fireworks going off in my head) and extreme trouble organizing thoughts. But my hair grew and I lost weight. My mood became stable and I was generally more upbeat. I stopped getting overly upset at small things and my energy skyrocketed. I have to wonder what must be in this medication that makes withdrawal reduce me to the fetal position, crying in a pool of sweat, and taking less of it makes my hair grow and restores my metabolism. I can't wait to be done with this. It's taken me to hell and back. It traps you into a physical dependency that makes it impossible to skip a dose or stop, because withdrawal is so scary and the half life is so short that if I forget to take it and leave for work in the morning, I have to anticipate getting sick by the afternoon. STAY AWAY FROM THIS STUFF, IT'S EVIL.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I must say I am shocked at the amount of negative responses this medication has received. I was diagnosed bipolar when I was 12, I am 26 now, and this is the ONLY drug that has worked for me. I have tried many, many medications and Effexor has had the best results with the least amount of side effects. Granted, the withdrawals are terrible, but if you are responsible and don't run out before you refill, this is not a problem. I have had NO weight gain because of this medication. column2: bunnykisses36, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Cognitive Therapy along with Effexor Xr has worked wonders for my social anxiety and my sense of hopelessness.  My dose is 150mg once in the morning.  HOWEVER...I went to Hawaii on vacation and forgot my meds.  Luckily I was able to get more but it took 4 days.  The first 2 days without Effexor Xr were tollerable.  The last 2 days I was extremely suicidal.  My withdrawal symptoms included extreme suicidal thoughts, awful taste, heebie-jeebies, clothes felt like sandpaper, people touching me freaked me out, socially a mess and horrible nightmares.  The devil was one step behind me...Mind you I was on holiday in Hawaii.  Hours after taking my dose I felt reborn and finally enjoyed the wonderful environment. This drug is very powerful. Every debilitating reason I took the drug was hightened 10 fold during withdrawals.  I don't have the funds to pay for the drug so Wyeth has supported me with free meds through their patient assistance program.  ....................NEVER DRING ALCOHOL WITH TAKING THIS DRUG.  MAJOR BLACKOUTS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!.................... I have read that some people have tried to get off it and could not.  COULD NOT.  Never being able to get off Effexor Xr makes me concerned, but alas, I will cross that bridge if I ever get there.

column2: Amy, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been on effexor xr since 1995.  I have high blood pressure, due to my excessive weight gain over the last twenty years.  I was 150lbs when I started taking the medication and now I am at 200lbs and struggling to get the weight off.  I went to the gym four times a week put in vigious exercise for an hour and a half and all I could take off was 10lbs.
