column2: me53, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was on this drug for 4 days. I had to get off it. I clinched my teeth so hard my jaws hurt. My teeth chattered like I was cold. I was sicker than any flu I ever had. I sweat gallons of water, then was cold. It was the worst drug I have ever been on. It should be off the market.

column2: Escaping, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Effexor xr has turned my life inside - out; and not for the good. I'm glad we have the chance to warn the public about this horrible drug. I don't care which experts say this medication is not addictive - they lie!!! It helps you in the beginning after you get passed the initial side effects. You then feel almost euphoric and happy. As you progress with the 'treatment' then I (along with many others) began to notice a change. You think you're just more confident and can't understand why everyone else thinks you've become an arrogant ass. That's because you are and don't realize it. You may become angry and act like a complete fool at 'the drop of a hat'. Then the darkness begins to cloud you're mind and you realize you've become a 'legal' junkie. You need this to feel in control. Nightmares may occur whenever you are able to actually sleep, dry mouth, weight gain, constipation, mood swings, dizzy spells and migraine headaches begin to occur more often; until you realize you're lost in a drug induced maze. I'm am fighting the worst battle of my life coming off of the Devil's candy. It will eventually destroy you.

column2: dvdderr@yahoo.com, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I took effexor for post p. depression.It worked great for a while but the increases in dose did not work.While i stopped taking effexor,I experanced the worst withdraws.The diizziness,vomiting,confusion,headaches,and the thought of going crazy was so unbearable.My husband almost took me to e.r. to get admitted!!!

column2: Vase, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been taking effexor for about 15 years, along with other antidepressants. (I've been on antidepressants since 1975.) I take 300mg in the morning and 75mg at night, along with Wellbutrin. . Effexor has worked very well most of the time. I still have the chronic crashes occasionally that can last for months, but that is the nature of the disease. I have none of the nausea, dizzy, or aggressive etc symptoms I read about here. The addictiveness is the only negative. I have gone into severe and dibilitating withdrawal when trying to trim down the dosage.  If I miss a dose I start wringing my hands, and become jumpy and fearful - even irrational. That makes me paranoid about running out, not being able to afford it, etc. even to the point of panic attacks. Antidepressants are also sneaky because you can think you are well and don't need it, when actually it is the pills themselves that make you better. If given a choice, I would still take the medication. It keeps me mostly non-suicidal (very rare - usually if pill supply is threatened) and as stable as one can expect. Yes I get angry about addictiveness, but I really appreciate not being so severely depressed, and being able to be functional, and at times even happy. I know too well the opposite.

column2: Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: VERY VERY BAD RESULTS. THIS STUFF IS TRASH AND WILL MAKE YOU MORE DEPRESSED OR CRAZY.

column2: chgocity, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: i have been on it for 3 months currently am taking the 150mg. I am alot more ruder, aggressive and also outspoken. In the three months i have gained 15lbs but i will say i am more at peace with myself feel great and love life much more.

column2: Zuzi, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: My Dr. prescibed this drug for me...low dose 37.5 mg, saying it woulld help my hot flashes, mood swings and also my IBS and maybe my Fibromyalgia.  Sounded like a wonder drug to me, and you know what they say about that.... if it sounds too good to be true, it is!  Well, I suffered through 2 weeks of nausea, a feeling of being in a light fog and restless nights.  After one month the nausea had disappeared and my dreams became weird causing me to wake up in a cold sweat and my mood swings were worse and the fogginess never went away.  This is the low dose, remember?  I came to WEB-MD and read what everyone else was saying and decided I did not want to continue on with this drug, which had done nothing for my meopause symptoms, IBS or Fibro...and in fact I had no appetite and lost 10 lbs...only plus I can think of! I don't think one drug is a miracle wonder for everyone.  I'm glad to see it helped some people, but I think I rather handle my problems more on a natural level.  I'm just happy that I was able to read all these reviews before taking anymore.  Brain zaps.....ugh! No thank you!

column2: Momma, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Very unstable while on Effexor. Taking it am and pm and not able to mantain a normal life. My husband hated me and so did everyone who I cam in contact with. Very suicidal while weaning off the drug. Please be very cautious.

column2: Concerned, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: When I first began Effexor XR 37.5 dose I was sick and unable to sleep but I noticed that I was improving emotionally. Then I progressed to the 75 dose I began experiencing fatigue and headaches; but I was beginning to feel more at ease and had better concentration and I was ready for the 150 dose, according go my doctor. When on the  150 dose I was at times experiencing extreme fatigue and weight gain, along with headaches and chronic constipation. However, I was extremely happy with the results in the beginning. I had self confidence that I never had before and was convinced that I would use this drug forever. I was calm and level headed and for once liked myself. Over a period of time I noticed my growing dependence on this drug. My weight gain was out of control and I bruised very easily. My self confidence turned into aggression that raged out of control. My family would not accompany me anywhere during this time because my temper was out of control and I would 'mouth off' to anyone who looked at me wrong. Then the dizzy spells started to occur and nightmares started. It has been a long road to hell and back trying to get off this drug. I will succeed in getting my life and family back. I'm now at the 75 dose again and my body is craving more Effexor - it's unreal. Next week I'll try to cut the dose to 37.5 but I am afraid because of all the hell I'm going through to get off these pills. Effexor XR will make a 'junkie' out of you - just because it's legal doesn't make it any better than the illegal street drugs. The symptoms are the same and it can eventually ruin your life.

column2: Suzzy, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

I take it at the same time every day, however, I did travel outside of my time zone and was several hours late in taking my meds. column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Withdrawing from Effexor XR is very difficult, leaving me feeling more ill than I ever have. column2: M.V.W-R, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I am very pleased with Effexor and how it helped me through some of my darkest hours.  The only issue I had while taking it was the side effects when a dose was taken late or missed.  I experienced tingling fingers and lips, my brain would feel like it was in a fish bowl that got seriously jostled.  I would feel discoordinated and would sometimes slur my words.  However, when taken routinely, with out missing a dose I would have no problems.  I did gain 30 pounds on it.  Now that I have stopped I have already lost 20 of those pounds.  The one question I would like to see asked is: "How hard is the drug to come off of."  I don't think enough people realize just how hard it is.  I have never been a drug user, so I cannot make the comparison, but imagine it is very similar to detoxing.  And I decreased slowly from 225mg at the direction and supervision of my psychiatrist.  It was horrible.  However, given where I was when I started the Effexor, I would do it all over again because it probably saved my life.  But be prepared for when your are ready to stop this medication.  Get your family prepared, come up with a plan of action and have constant support.  Coming off of the Effexor has definetly been one of the hardest things I have ever had to do.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: This is the worst pill I have evr taken in my life! I was taking 225MG everyday for a year and a half and I had very little side affects while I was taking it (trouble sleeping,nightmares,profuse sweating)but it seemed to lose effectivness very quickly. Rather than continue to up my dosage I was switched to 300MG of Wellbutrin once a day. I felt better while taking both medications but now that I am trying to get off of the Effoxor Xr I feel like I'm dying! I have gone from super happy to crying to total rage all within the last 2 hours. I was instructed to slowly lower my dosage over 2 weeks which I did and I don't think that was slow enough. I can not focus and I feel like I am going to vomit every second of the day. The pain in my head is not even comparable to a headache or migrain. Everytime I turn my head I feel like I am going to fall over and driving HA! thats a joke.I have been completley off of this pill for only 3 days and I have fully come to understand why addicts relapse. This should not be on the market and it should not be given out as quickly as it is. Doctors don't tell you that hey it may work for awhile but then when you come off of it you are worse than before you started taking it. I would NEVER recommend taking this regardless of how bad you think your depression is. Trust me it is much harder to deal with the thoughts and feelings while coming off this drug than it is to deal with the depression. If you do feel you need medication which I agree some do such as myself all I can say is do your research before you take anything, I wish I had done that.I would love to know if there is anything I can do to ease the withdrawl symptoms, please if anyone can help let me know before I end up taking another pill to make it stop!

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Effexor XR 75mg for 4.5 years now.  It has given me my life back.  It took me a long time to admit that I might be depressed, as I didn't want to face what I perceived as a stigma against depressed folks as deficient in character, lacking in faith, or "crazy."  Finally things got so bad (not getting out of bed on the weekends, suicidal thoughts), that I "gave up" and went to see a counselor.  That was the best decision of my life (other than marrying my wife.. although I guess you could say that THAT wouldn't have happened had I not sought help!).So after seeking help seven years ago I was diagnosed with double depression and started off with Prozac.  That didn't work, so switched to Zoloft.  Zoloft worked on my depression and I can vividly remember the joy of seeing leaves rustle in sunlight about 5 weeks after starting Zoloft and feeling happy for the first time years.  I gained 20 pounds of fat and lost my sex drive almost completely, but I was so happy to be "alive" again that I lived with those side effects for a couple of years.  Eventually I wanted more, so I dropped Zoloft cold turkey, lost weight, sex drive came back, but so did depression.  Finally got on Effexor XR and it has been a miracle.  A little sex drive lessening but not a lot, and no sexual function problems at all.  My depression has stayed away for the 4 years I've been on this drug.  This drug has worked wonders for me, and I hope that it will for you.  Realize that no one drug works for everyone, and that you do have to try out different medications to find the one for you.One thing -- if I skip a dose I can immediately tell, because I get a little dizzy, a little headache, etc.  I've heard that trying to go off Effexor can be very tricky.  Apparently if you want to go off you need to gradually lower the dose or switch to another med that can help while you're coming off of Effexor and then "wean" off of that.God bless.

column2: t-ray, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: i am a 34 yr old female who has suffered from major depression for about 5 years and effexor xr is the first medication that actually worked, it is the first medication that actually made me feel happiness and joy that i had been unable to feel for many years, it has in my opinion saved my life and given my sense of self back to me. it took about 7 days before i had felt anything after treatment started and i take 150mg every day and fully intend to take this medication for the rest of my life. it honestly saved my life because before i started this medication i honestly could not have continued living the way that i was before, i was empty and actually had no feeling at all in me but sadness, anxiety and dispair. i have no idea why i became so depressed in my late 20's it was after i gave birth to my last child and i know that as a teen and in my 20's i suffered from mild depression that progressed to the deepest darkest place that i have ever been and have no intent on ever going back there.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I was started on this med by suggestion of my ARNP for hot flashes.  It worked well; my hot flashes all but subsided within a few days.  However, now a few years later, my blood pressure rose very high(up to 240/150) over the month of April 2008 with headaches and loss of conciousness twice from blood pressure elevation while driving.  I am now not allowed to drive, climb ladders, steps(which means I can't sleep in my bed but fold out couch which is uncomfortable, mow grass because of the possibility of passing out. This is horrible since we live in a small town 1/2 hour from nearest medical facility.Within the past month, my blood pressure meds have been increased or new ones added multiple times to try to lower my pressure.  In the meantime, multiple tests were done for the obvious reasons for high BP---all negative.  These included brain tumor, adrenal tumor, kidney problems, hormonal. Last week of April and beginning of May had adverse effect from a blood pressure med causing my pressure to drop up to 100 points which caused me to pass out and to be hospitalized for IV fluids to bring my pressure back up to 100.  It was like a yoyo.  Horrible month.In hospital for another battery of tests, with all negative.  Effexor stopped and most of BP meds stopped.  Then blood pressure was too low.  Am now very tired, shaky, lip tremors, antsy since med stopped after tapering.  This is not worth the hot flashes--I would rather have them than what I have gone through the past month and half and more since I can't drive.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column9: The problem was that it was too easy to use and not easy to stop using.  It has created side effects worse than the depression I first started taking it for.  I now have episodes of extreme anger, and self harm and fear that I may one day harm one of my young children.  I am very distressed with the fact that I have tried to taper off and have severe withdrawals.  I am more depressed because of the side effects and withdrawals than I was before I began taking Effexor. I wish I had sought a more natural approach to depression such as diet changes, exercise, and support groups.  I am disappointed that my insurance will pay for this drug and not for the herbal supplements that have been more effective and not detrimental to my health?  Why do they allow me to take a medication that is causing me physical and mental harm and yet shun the very things that could improve my health in every arena?  I am angered that I have lost ten years of my life and have damaged the relationships with my loved ones due to side effects and inability to quit taking this medication. Those who promote this drug need to know that I fully regret taking Effexor when there are other avenues. More natural, healthy and effective methods should be actively encouraged before prescribing such a  damaging drug. This should be a LAST alternative, if not totally banned.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Was placed on low dose for depression in 1999, over past 9 years went to 75mg, then 150mg, but side effects scared me. Went back to 75mg for several more years.  Positives - no noticeable depression.  Negatives:  Insomnia, anxiety, vivid & strange dreams, severe headaches, lashing out at loved ones, night sweats and diminished sex drive. Finally had enough and wanted off.  With doc's advice, was weaned to lower dosage of 37.5mg, then advised to take 1 XR every other day until the drugs were gone.  It's been 2 months and I've noticed fewer headaches and less blurred vision; slight increase in sex drive. But, I am dealing with increased anxiety and almost hypersenstive emotions - quick to anger; quick to cry.  Can't bear the idea of going back to drugs so I'm exploring other ways to deal with this.  Please explore other methods of dealing with your depression or anxiety before becoming too dependant on a "magic pill."

column2: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I am not only dissapointed with this medication, but I am also diturbed by it. I lost best friends, fell into the wrong croud, and fell totally behind in school. I grew up singing, dancing, and involved myself in art all my life until soon after I started taking the meddication. Coming off the meddication I did what my doctors told me to do, but during the intense withdrawl I tried to committ suicide three times - something totally out of character for me. I have stablized somewhat now, but I am still fell the both harsh physical and mental pain and frustration coming off of it. My doctor didn't think twice when she raised my dose after I became severly depressed and cut my arm open to such an extent I passed out from blood loss. I never felt that way before the medds. During this time I never thought something could do so much damage, and I trusted my doctors and parents. It's sad to think of myself naive when I decieded to finally try meddiction to help my at the time non-sucidal depression. My mom went on effexor to and I feel like I dont even know her any more. So far no one I have talked to believes me or cares to hear about the situation. This drug has piosoned my life, and it scares me that other people could have half the problems I did with it. For this drug to be put out on the market makes the world of XR even yet worse than it already does. This cover-up attempt at "wellness" is just another drug deal except now the government can claim their share half publicly. Drugs are not disapearing any time soon, but this is rediculous.

column2: MeBooNZoo, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: All my life I have suffered from depression, anxiety, anger and ADD.  I have tried Zoloft, Wellbutrin, and Prozac but they just didn't do the trick.  Effexor XR has made me a new person with zero side effects.  I felt better from the first day I started the 37.5 dose and I'm now at 75. Along with ALL my symptoms being relieved, I have the added benifit of reduced hunger and carb cravings.  For the first time in a long time, I don't obsess over food, feel like I'm starving even though I just ate or only feel satisfied eating high carb things.  I sleep better and wake up refreshed.  I've never felt so normal and productive in my life!  I'm drinking more water, I'm more motivated which means more active and in 2 weeks, I've lost 7 pounds without much effort or depriving myself. I've read all the horror stories on the net and just thought this medicine needed some positive feedback.  Just because it gave you some horrible side effects doesn't mean it's bad.  It just means its not for you.  Please don't use scare tactics to keep someone from trying it as it could change their life they way it has mine.  I am aware of the withdrawal symptoms but because I feel so much better, I look forward to taking my pill in the morning so I don't miss a dose and I never plan on going off of it.

column2: USMC wife, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Effexor for 12 days using the 35mg/75mg 2 week packet.  I have definitely noticed a huge difference in my thinking.  I have suffered from mild depression since a young child but finally seeked medical help.  At the moment my mind wants to drift to negative, pesimistic thoughts I can literally feel Effexor perk me up.  Unfortunately, I am also beginning to feel the side effects.  For the past 2 days, I feel like I am extremely hungry one minute, and within a split second I'm nausious.  For the past 5 days, I have been experiencing dreams that range from weird to deathly scary.  Within 3 days of my first dosage, I could tell my sex drive was gone.  After reading the numerous comments (good and bad) about Effexor, I have decided to come off of it.  Luckily I haven't been using it for very long.  For anyone considering Effexor, I strongly suggest that you do your homework on this medication; and if you do decide to try it, promise yourself that you will not let a doctor tell you that you need more mg to fix the problem.  Trust yourself and listen to your body.

I am still very satisfied with how this medication has helped my depression and my ability to deal with things.  The major side effect I have noticed is stomach problems.  I had severe cramping for the first week after the dosage increase and problems with reflux.  The cramping has subsided and antacids are helping with the reflux. column2: stummee, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Anytime a drug lists tons of side affects on a medication it makes me question it. I have a family history of having high cholesterol and it surprised me that my doctor increased my dose to 225 mg. Grrrrr! Case studies show that Effexor can increase cholesterol and triglyceride levels. My cholesterol has gone up 25 points and triglyceride level went up 100 points. I don't think doctors really look into the effects of medications enough! I'm tired of playing doctor with myself and doing their job. I'm the one who has to look into drug interactions and side-affects, they don't. Also, I found out you are not to mix it with Zyrtec because it increases somnolence. I was wondering why I was extremely tired and dizzy. Again, I had to play doctor with myself! I am tired of it!!!

column2: elephantlover, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I've been taking effexor xr for 7 or 8 years. It has worked wonders, but in the long-term I find that the side effects become overwhelming. I'm now maxed out at 300mg and have severe withdrawl symptoms every night. Because the med makes me a little hyperactive, I take it around 2:30am so that when it reaches full strength in my system it's time to wake up. The bummer about this schedule is that I have terrible nightmares and the worst night-sweats (soaking my sheets and pajama's) because of the withdrawl symptoms. If I miss a dose (god forbid!!) the withdrawls are crippling - headaches; shooting electricity type feelings originating from inside my skull and radiating out into my entire body; drastic mood swings; violent outbursts and uncontrolable anger; feeling unawake and groggy. This is just a partial list. I would like to taper off this medication, but I'm afraid of the withdrawls. Effexor has been great at treating my depression and helping me to take control. If anyone has successfuly gone off of effexor, I would appreciate any tips or advice you could share.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking 75 mg of Effexor for about a year and a half. I have loved everything about the medication. I have generalized anxiety disorder as well as social anxiety. I have had these symptoms my entire life but I started to have frequent panic attacks, so I started to take this medication. (I have tried several other prescriptions but this one worked wonders for me!) I now suffer less anxiety attacks, I have become more outgoing and less nervous in social situations and my mild depression has diminished. The down side to this was the fact that I have gain a significant amount of weight (25lbs) while taking Effexor and decided about two months ago that I wanted to try life without it. I have been having the worst withdrawals!! I started to take it every other day and would feel constantly slightly dizzy throughout the day. But I pushed through it and it is now IMPOSSIBLE to try and take it every three days. My body is physically addicted to this medication! I can not explain how awful the withdrawl symptoms are. My head feels fuzzy along with my vision, I have awful headaches and feel so dizzy it makes me extremely nauseous. I just lost my insurance and had to pay $150.00 for the prescription because I can't make it three days without taking it. This is a great medication but the symptoms and side effects are tough to deal with.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I switched from Zoloft to 75mg of Effexor XR about 6 months ago and I have been very happy with the results.  Insomnia is a problem however and I have to take Ambien CR to sleep and I have some mild sexual effects.  Headaches are a problem if I miss a dose.  In my opinion the benefits of this drug far outweigh the side effects.  My dose has just been increased to 150mg due to some mild loss of effectiveness at the lower dose, but given my current life circumstances this is not surprising.  Since starting Effexor I have lost the weight the Zoloft made me gain, I have less social anxiety, and I am able to deal with things MUCH better.  I am generally happier with life in general and I would recommend this medication.

column2: smf, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I didn't realize I was having panic attacks. I just thought I was just an emotional person. But when uncontrollable crying started to occur for no apparent reason, I sought help. It was effecting my job, my family, and my activity level. I found myself opting out of social engagements simply because I never knew when I would break into tears.I've been taking 37.5 dosage of Effexor for 2 years. I was worried that I would be emotionally dead. But that hasn't occurred. I still find myself in unexplained emotional moments, but now I can get it under control. My family life, work life, and social life have dramatically improved. I'm no longer the introvert that I had become.I do have very vivid dreams, but no problem sleeping. I did gain weight, so I increased the length of my daily walking routine and that helped. I have noticed less sex drive, but now that my husband and I recognize what's causing it, we're able to work through it with no problems. I do get hot flashes, but I'm learning how to deal with that, too. All in all, I'm a much happier, even-tempered person. It's a relief. Effexor is simply be a part of my life from now on.

column2: Lloyd, 75 or over Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I came from a family with a lot of mental disorders on my mothers side. Of my 81 years of age, I have been depressed for over half my life. I have been through all kinds of depression medication. So far I believe that effexor has helped me more than the others. Not wanting to be on medication, when I started feeling better I started cutting back on the dosage from 5 tablets of 75mg to 2 tablets of 75 mg. This was without my doctor's approval. While on a trip, I ran out of medication for about 3 days. I went into a deep depression which I describe as a living hell. After I saw my doctor, and he chewed my ass out for cutting back on the medicatin without his knowledge, he thought I would be on the maximum amount and dossage the rest of my life.Rather than going back down into that deep dark valley,although I dont feel that I am complety over my depression, I wil stay with his recommendations.

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have had depression for as long as I can remember and was diagnosed with it early in my adult life. I had been through prozac, which I loved at first, but after a few years lost its effectiveness. Apparently antidepressants do that after prolonged use. I have been thought Zoloft, Wellbutrin and I think Cymbalta, I'm not real sure about Cymbalta.Anyhow, the Effexor has been working, I'm actually taking its generic version Veneflexine (I think that's how it's spelled)  It was slow to work at first and I think my Dr got a little crazy with the dosages as he had me taking 5 pills a day. Although I convinced him I could get by with less and I'm taking 300 mg, or 3 a day. It's somewhat inconvenient in that I take 2 in the morning and 1 at night, but aside from that I have been happy with it. No real side effects, possibly insomnia, but I've had that before I started taking it.I just know what I was like before I started taking it, and what I'm like now and it does work. I never really had a major problem with anxiety, perhaps once very rarely usually situational in cause, however I can't say that I've experienced in anxiety since I've taken it, but then again haven't had much situations to cause it either....whew!I personally would give the medication a thumbs up.  It does work, however everyone's wired slightly different. So if it doesn't work, don't give up on your treatment. There are a lot of medications out there, and keep searching until you find the right one, it will definitely make life worth living again.

column9: Effexor XR has made my anxiety double. I'm in a constant state of paranoia and I feel like I'm stoned 24/7....like my head is in a bubble. I am even scared to drive. I am experiencing the same side affects as others have previously listed.... tremors, skin crawling, trouble sleeping, horrible nightmares, always sweating, feels like I am going crazy!!!I've been on this for almost 2 months and I  am seeing my Dr. tomorrow because I need to be taken off of this. PLEASE BE CAREFUL if you are considering taking this medication!!!! I regret not reading the reviews prior to taking effexor!

column1: Extreme Apprehension or Fear of Social Interaction

column9: I am one person that believes that people that take pills to control emotions was prety mech absurd.  however, when my situation in life seemed much more than I could handle, i felt, ok i guess things couldnt get worse, ill go ahead and try.  it help me almost immediatly,  ive been taking it for about two months now.  although i believe i may be pregnant, im a bit nervous, and scared, because of any withdrawls i may experience.  i cannot find any information suggesting that effexor wouldnt be harmful to the fetus.  i do recommend this drug.

column2: shell, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I suffer from anxiety, panic attacks and NOW depression. I was on Lexapro for about 2 years and I felt "normal". I miss that. I guess my body got used to it b/c I started getting the same episodes back. So my Dr. switched my medication. I have been off of Lexapro for a few months now and I have been on only 75MG of Effexor XR for about 2 months. I feel worse than when I started. I am 26 years old... I'm engaged..and I have absolutely NO sex drive at all. My mood swings are indescribable. I cry more now than EVER before. Whats worse is that my anxiety has doubled since starting Effexor and I have become severely depressed. I feel like I am in a fog... like I'm "drugged up". I am always nauseous, I have no appetite. I am always sweating, feel shaky, I can't sleep anymore... I am a mess. I am experiencing feelings I have never felt before. I know these drugs are not overnight wonders... I know I will not feel better overnight. But I also know, I shouldn't be feeling as worse as I am. After reading all of the comments, I have made an appointment with my Dr. I need to be taken off of this ASAP!!! The side effects are just making me feel worse. I feel like hell.

column2: Effective, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I have had no problem with Effexor XR, it fact it is a life saver to me. I was suffering from severe panic attacks and did try to commit suicide. I have been on this medication for 5 years now. I am 59 years old, and suffered from depression since my 30's. My only warning about this medication is DO NOT RUN OUT OF IT, always make sure you have your prescription, just one day without Effexor and it feels as though electric shocks are going off in my brain every 2 to 3 minutes, I cannot relax but I am able to focus. It is not a pleasant experience, so I always make sure I don't run out of it.

column2: silvero333, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I started taking Effexor at 14 for Major Depression. The dosage was increased steadily until I switched to Zoloft at 21. While I credit the Effexor with helping me avoid survive my depression, it wasn't until I stopped taking it that I realized the severity of the side effects. From the age of 14 to 21, I experienced no sex drive. I would not recomend this drug for teens.

column2: Dwayne, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: For about 3-4 years I was on 225mg a day then it started not to work as well then I started to not care if I lived or died, very lethargic,apathetic about everything and unable to function working (basically the same as before I was taking the meds).  I am now on 300mgs Efexor and 300mgs of Wellbutrin a day and am ok again. However, with the increased meds I do suffer with some ED and lack of sexual desire and some lack of overall emotions.  So beware at about 3 to 5 years as you may need an increase in dosage(not just me, read through the reviews and you will see). The "great" thing about efexor if I miss a dosage after about 4 hours extreme headaches and dizziness remind me to take it. I do not look forward to the day I ever try to get off this med, as just taking a pill late can give me such a killer headache, and taking the dose does not immediately take it away. So even if the drug works well for a long time, keep an eye on yourself as you may need an increase later on!

column9: I took the brand name for 4 weeks, then my ins.refused to pay for it,I was forced to take the generic, which has been a disaster for me. I have had terrible side effects and weaned myself off of it, and am having withdrawal. I have never felt this bad in my life. I called my ins. co. and complained to 8 people over a period of 6 weeks, before I could speak to a supervisor.I will not tke a drug made in a foreign country in light of what has just happened with heprin. As a result of taking the generic,I felt like I was leaving my body physically and mentally. The generic form of Effexor just about did me in, as I was told I had to tke 150 mg.of it to get the same benefits of the brand. I was also  told that paroxitine was a generic for Effexor. I worked in the health care industry for over forty years and know better.How sad that we have people deciding what meds our ins. will pay for who have no more drug education than this.Because I still work, I do not qualify for a $0 copay and because my ins. will not pay for the brand. The brand Effexor was on the formulary at the beginning of 2008, but disappeared a week after I tried to fill my Rx. I guess i grew up in a time when peoples lives had some meaning and money wasn't the priority.

column2: Maggy, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Bipolar disorder I

column2: Shelly, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: BEWARE~ I Had to stop taking Effexor XR 150mg abruptly (did not have the money to get my prescription). I have experienced EXTREMELY HORRIBLE side affects. My brain feels like I have an electrical shortage (7 days--continuously). My family is falling apart because they CANNOT help me. I hurt all over--from head to toe. These "jolts" in my brain make me feel awful, which naturally alters my mood because there is NOTHING that can be done to take this away! Not to mention that after I started taking Effexor XR several years ago, it decreased my sex drive; resulting in difficulty having an orgasm (something I did not have a problem with before taking Effexor)!  I have no desire for sex, even though I find my husband so very sexy! Additionally, I struggle with constipation; have abnormal dreams; weight loss was great (at the beginning) but not withstanding; my cholesterol and blood pressure have been up and down like my weight; and I forget a lot details and dates (something that is not conducive to my family or profession). There are times I feel like in my effort to try to minimize my anxiety, I developed something much worsean Effexor XR addiction!  If you plan to stop taking Effexor XR abruptly, I strongly urge you to consider the side affects (withdrawal symptoms) with your doctor. I do not know how long this will last, but I am fighting it--barely. I feel completely helpless against these symptoms, and I do not ever want to go through this again.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Wanted to get off of Prempro but was still incurring hot flashes daily, Dr. recommended Effexor.  I was leary but is has worked very well.  Suggest others looking to get off Prempro talk to their doctor.

column2: Dee, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: The chemotherapy I was on for breast cancer induced early menopause. My hot flashes were out of control and my life was miserable. I was constantly turning my fan off and on at my desk causing a lot of embarrassment. My sleep was constantly disrupted. My cancer was not estrogen receptive, but since I tested positive for BRCA1, I was unable (nor did I want) to take any type of estrogen. My gynecologist prescribed Effexor XR and within a very short period of time, the hot flashes disappeared by at least 95%. Thanks Wyeth for making this drug available to those of us that need it for this reason!

column9: EffexorXR worked great for my temporary depression when I first started taking it.  It seemed like after a few years that it wasn't working as effectively with my monthly PMS,too.  The doctors asked me if I wanted to increase the dosage(sure glad I didn't).  Now five years later, I want to discontinue taking Effexor and I feel horrible.  I have been decreasing the dosage as my doctor instructed and only stopped taking it all together for five days and feel HORRIBLE.  I have all the symptoms that everyone else describes.  It is really sad to hear that one writer says he/she feels the withdrawal symptoms still have 6 months.  I wish I had known about the terrible withdrawl symptoms when I first started taking it.  I would have reconsidered.  I would definitely tell anyone out there to try other anti-depressants before taking this drug.  My doctor is putting me back on the low dose 37.5 mg because of my symptoms.  I am determined to get off this drug sooner or later.  I think I will try the antioxidants that other writers have been talking about and perhaps suggest to my doctor to take Prozac.

column2: ohbiteme, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I've been on Effexor for over four years.  The dosage was increased 12/10/07 to 225 mg / day.  My psychiatrist pulled me off the medication as of 3/5/08.  I'm going through some serious withdrawals due to the elimination of this medication.  I'm in a partial hospitalization program for treatment of bi-polar, however, I was told there was nothing that could be done regarding the withdrawal symptoms.  Everyone I've talked to say that quitting Effexor cold turkey is EXTREMELY bad due to side affects.  I hurt from hair to toe nail.  I experience "jolts" in my brain; I have constant ringing in my ears; my mood changes are awful.  If you are ever instructed to cease this medication immediately and abruptly, I strongly urge you to discuss the side affects (withdrawal symptoms) with your MD--it's the hardest thing I've ever done and I don't know how long it will take before the medication is completely out of my system.  I feel completely helpless against these symptoms.  I don't ever want to go through something like this again.

column2: Courtney, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years
column9: I took Effexor XR for 9 years.  I decided to go off of the drug, cold turkey.  During the process I went from crying all the time.  I couldn't say anything without crying.  My brain felt like electroyde were going off all the time.  I felt very bad.  The worst thing that it did was take away my taste buds for over a month.  I couldn't taste ANYTHING.  I found a web site that mentioned this reaction and showed it to my doctor.  He called the drug company.  They were not aware of this happening.  I had printed out the artical on the web site and the drug company were really surprised.  I'm off on Effexor XR but couldn't handle the return of depression and anixety so am now on Lexapro.  Not sure if I like it yet.  I've been on this a year.

column2: philwzen, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: Oringinally presribed for depresion over 12 years ago. It has an immediate effect  20 mins afer taking first dose i was laughing !!! longer term removed some of the deperesssio and most of the anxiety sysptoms. Caused high blood presure and increase in weight, total suppression of any sex drive, impotence. benefits did not last and extreme discontinuation symptoms when trying to stop even though tapered off over several months and finally replaced with prozac which was then tappered off as well. withdrawal symptoms persist still after 6 months of not taking effexor. one dose of prozac or effexor removes symptoms immediately so not a recurrance of original problem. i Would only recommend using effexor as a last resort it is virtually impossible to stop taking it once you start. Withdrawal efects i have had are worse than original problem. I now have severe confusion, mania, violent outbursts and physical manifestations include dizzyness , trembling limbs, sweats, stomach problems. The original depression is still present and the anxiety is if anything worse. however i have been on virtually all the different types of medications in the past 30 years and effexor was the firt to make a difference, but at what a price?!.

column9: As others have stated, if a dose is missed or late the is hell to pay.  Terrible whirling feeling.  I have taken this for 7 years.  This is the second time I've tried to get off this drug.  1st time the doctor and I assumed that I just wasn't ready and the symptoms were the depression.  This past month I am going to get off the medication come hell or high water.   Enough is enough.  I feel terrible, have gained 50 lbs since I started it, problems with blood pressure and I see someone is having issues with liver.  Bingo, so am I.  Don't know quiet yet, I am being tested.I feel like hell right now.  Body aches, ringing in ears, whirling ,felling like crying, bolting,  almost like a flu, muscles hurt.   But have reading all these reactions, I am going to give it all I have to get off of this stuff.   Aren't the drug companies at fault for this kind of problem.  I was not told, read, heard anything that this was a possibility.   I would have tried something else for the depression.  I glad to see that I'm not alone, but also sorry to hear so many are having the same problem.  I tried to tell my doctor that I read how difficult it was to get off this, but she said, yes you can.   I didn't think to ask, at what expense.   On the flip side, if she didn't give a positive attitude you might wallow in that idea.   All in all, this stinks.   I feel like hell and hoping that I'll make it out of this drug.All the best to those who are trying as well.Kathie, NY

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Have been taking 225 mg of Effexor XR daily for 18 months. Have had many of the same side effects others mentioned, but the one bothering me most (and the one least mentioned by others) is memory loss!  Words are completely lost to me at times...I know the word I want to use is somewhere in my brain, but can't come up with it.  I mix up words, forget names, can't remember where I put things.  Sense of time also seems "off".  Something that happened yesterday can feel like years ago and vice versa.  More tired now than ever.  I could sleep most of the day.  In general my mood is much improved, but sometimes I feel like I'm loosing my mind.  My husband says I've improved incredibly on Effexor, so I guess I'm staying on it. I'd like to think there's something better out there, but I'm afraid of withdrawing from Effexor.  Have been on Prozac and Paxil over the years before switching to Effexor.

column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I was givin this drug for minor depression.  If anything it just made me feel numb to my emotions.  I understand the need for mood stablizers, but I feel they're made available too easily.  Doctors seem too ready to hand out medication to mask the problem rather than work it out.  The worst part of this drug (beside the minor, but annoying side effects) was the withdrawl.

Do NOT take this drug. It worked while I was on it for a while. Then I began to feel flat and couldn't experience any type of emotions. I couldn't be happy or sad. My doctor began to taper me off of it and it's been hell.I NEVER would have taken effexor to begin with if I had known how severe the withdrawal symptoms were. I did fine tapering off until I quit altogether after being on the lowest dose for 2 weeks. I can't function, I can't think, I feel dizzy, hot flashes, headaches and I pretty much just feel like I'm going crazy. I felt better being depressed. I have a whole new respect for drug addicts. If detox is anything like this, no wonder the relapse rate is so high.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had previously been on Paxil and Zoloft.  Neither of which worked as well as Effexor.  I had no real side effects going onto Efferox which was great. All in all I am sad to see Effexor go I am very happy with it.

column2: JW, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: Effexor XR changed my life. Going on 6 years taking it, and I even reduced from 150mg to 75mg a few years ago. I have trouble with the sweating and a little sleep trouble - but I am more than happy to deal with that rather than the panic attacks and fits of rage, depression and hyperness... I live my days very calm now, and my relationships don't suffer anymore. I can't imagine going back to those extreme highs and lows.  The only thing I worry about are the long term effects - I would eventually like to trial a 'natural' solution, but for now I won't risk the contentment.

I meant to add that my doc mentioned if I had any real problems coming off the Effexor XR she'd put me on 20 mg of Prozac daily for a week and then discontinue all meds.  With the very long half-life of Prozac and its active by-products you'll come off very gradually without having to do anything else.

Wasn't working well, so decided to try and get off it after a couple of years.  Awful!!  So I'm now trying again, reducing dosage by dividing granules in 75 mg XR capsules, taking 37.5 mg for a week, then about half that or 18 mg for a second week, and then zero after that.  I read several posts in rx.com that people were having success boosting their antioxidants during coming off Effexor, so I'm also doing that and having a much easier time of it this time around.

column2: Ancaster, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I wrote of my experience on day 5 and remember just wishing someone would write further into the withdrawl.  I am now on day 20 and things have really improved. It was not until day 17 that I actually noticed some of the symptoms that were always present, had minimized.  I did try Benedryl and it helped the dissiness for me. I also take Omega 3 along with vitamins and alot of water, and working out a few times a week. Things are so much better than they were a week ago.  I still have a way to go...but after feeling so horrible ...this is a relief that lets you believe there is light at the end of the tunnel...in my opinion, this drug should NEVER be prescribed for Menopause Symptons or for the depression associated with it...the withdrawl effects and prior side effects are far too extreme...I weaned down 6 months at a time to the lowest dose and it was still overwhelming coming off this last dose...my heart goes out to those beginning the cold turkey phase...but know that at the point you're sure going back on it will be better, that if you persevere you will be free of it's horrible hold on you...I am hoping for the symtom free day ... but right now this is sooooo much better....

column2: doin alright, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My doctor took me off Paxil several years ago when I began having some anxiety attacks. He instead prescribed Effexor. 3 words. LUCY, SKY, DIAMONDS. When I wasnt so paraniod I was staring into the mirror thinking "I know you..Im inside", I was trying to mask out the sounds of little girls singing like on a playground with a soft orchistra in the background. I would run to the bathroom several times a day and look at that poor guy in the mirror having a bad trip and say "I'm you and your messed up". When I called my doctor and said what was going on he said "double the dose". For some reason I didnt think of it but after crying for 48 hours and begging the doctor to stop it he just said "dont take anymore". In 7-8 hours I was fine. daaa. oh, and all that happened in 4 days. Going back to Paxil was like inviting in an old friend....

column2: Healed4good, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Treatment wasn't bad...until I decided to go off of it. I was given a heavy dose 300 mg/day. On it for ~18 months. Started to reduce the dosage and what I call 'neurochemelectrical discharges' started zapping my brain. It was tolerable and expected. Kept reducing the dosage slowly as directed. Finally made it down to 37.5mg/1x day and the 'neurochemeletrical' circus was raging...but slightly tolerable. Went totally off and felt like I was back in college having the worst psychadelic experience of my life. Called the Dr. and picked up two more titration packets with the 37.5s and eased them back in and then started staggering them every other day and longer. My brain finally settled down a little. I was ready to stop again, and did so. I was still seeing (and mostly feeling...tracers) but they were tolerable. I was off for 8 days...yes 8 (eight, 7+1, etc.) so it was out of my system but the psychadelic party was still going. I broke down and took a 75mg capsule I had...just in case... Bottom line. THIS STUFF IS REALLY, REALLY DIFFICULT TO GET OFF OF! Please consider this if your Dr. suggests it. Believe me, I know how bad things may seem, but please consider all options. I now have to start the original (or generic) Effexor at 25 mg for 7 days and then split them to 12.5 mg for 7 days. I am pretty tough (now anyway...) by most standards but this (withdrawl) is, in my opinion, worse than depression. I know how to take care of that now without meds. Just please look into it before getting on it.

column9: I took this for 6 months to for migraine prevention.  It did a great job of preventing the migraines (only one in 6 months compared to 3-4 a month before I started taking it.) I went off cold turkey 3 days ago and WOW what a surprise. I have been having estremely severe mood swings (not good when you have 3 children under the age of 6), crying at the drop of a hat, and a weird buzzing in my head.  I thought I was having a nervous breakdown - I couldn't figure out what was wrong with me.  This whole episode has scared me (and my husband.)  I just now have read all of the posts regarding withdrawal symptoms and am so thankful that they are there and that everyone has shared their stories;  now I know that there is a reason that I am acting so irrational.  I just hope the withdrawal symptoms end soon.

I have been taking this medication for about four years now. While taking the medication, I have had the dosage adjusted several times. The most prevalent side effect for me was hot flashes and weight gain. Under medical supervision, I tried to decrease the dosage of the medication in an attempt to ultimately stop taking it. Yet, as the dosage was decreased I found myself becoming more depressed and even suicidal. Therefore, I had to increase the dosage again. I feel that this medication has contributed to my hypersomnia. However, my doctor disagrees. I will continue to seek a change in my medication. Yet, I will continue to take this medication for the time being. I take three 75 mg tabs once a day.

column9: I have been on this medication for three years now..I had a man try to take my life and this put me in a very scared and dark place..Depression, panic attacks and PTSD..Anxiety came out of no where without reason..I have learned that even if you are not physicaly scared, emotionaly you are and your subconcious can trigger it..Effexor has does wonders for me..I am still nervous at times but I can manage it now..Now, I do understand the whole "BRAIN BOUNCING" issue..If I miss one day I get that but the thing is, Don't quit cold turkey..These types of medicans are strong and you should slowly reduce your intake over a six month process atleast..Effexor is not for everybody and you must give all medicanes one to even five months to work effectivly..I hope this helps some of you..If you have any questions about it and not sure sure, I can try to help..ringo_angela@yahoo.com

column2: dinkydo2733@yahoo.com, 35-44 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: OK here goes. I wrote earlier about having the severe pms..........well my Dr. told me to just stop taking it. OMG!!! I have been so sick for 3 days. Let me tell you about it. I now am on Zanax just to help me get through the day. I cant sleep. Oh and did I mention once again, the brain zaps. These things are just unreal. They are happening about 15-20 times in one single minute. Its aweful. I really would love to know when this is gonna quit. I want everyone to know I really wish I would have checked the med out 1st or at least got on here to read about getting off the medicine.  I have to say this is one of the worst things I have ever gone through in my life. It makes you wanna cry because I dont know if I will ever be normal again. Ive asked the drs and the pharmacist about these brain zaps and they say they dont know what Im talking about. PLease someone tell me if they truely end and when. Or if theres any relief from them.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I have been using Effexor XR in conjunction with Klonopin for anxiety attacks that started 2 years ago (I take 300 mg at night).  I tried Zoloft first, and it was great for the anxiety, but gave me the attention span of a gnat.  Unlike most of these reviewers, I take it at night, because it makes me sleepy (it has really helped me sleep well, actually).  I am weaning off the Klonopin now, because the XR has been really effective.  I have not experienced sexual side effects or weight gain on this drug - the only noticable side effect I've had is dry mouth - and that just makes me drink more water, which is good for you anyway.  The best thing I've done besides the medication for anxiety is quitting the caffeine entirely.  If you have any kind of panic or anxiety disorder, this is probably the best thing you can do for yourself after getting medical help!  And even though I am not very "new agey", I've taken up Kundalini Yoga, which focuses primarily on breathing (good for when you're feeling anxious) and Hatha Yoga (which is great for relieving stress).  Try it, you'll like it! While I was happy with the zoloft besides being a bit flighty, this just goes to show that if the first drug you try doesn't work, there are others to try - don't give up!  Be honest with your doctor, and you WILL find something that helps you!

column2: wisconsinite, 45-54 on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Been on Effexor XR 75 mgs for about 2 yrs for anxiety which I suffered from since 5th grade.   It completely changed my life.  Don't obsess about little stuff anymore, I feel more alive and in tune that I have in a very long time. Dry mouth side effect is a small price to pay.  Helps my peri-menoupasal symptoms also very much. I sleep very well. I can tell when I've missed a pill.  I tried Zoloft and Celexa before being put on this and neither had the effect the effexor has. To those who have been on depression anxiety medication that hasn't help, ask your Dr. to switch you, it's worth trying more than one kind.  It's been a godsend for me.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)

column2: nurse and wife of patient, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Caregiver)
column9: My husband was on Effexor for about 2 years and it worked great for him. He started the medication after he became depressed, paranoid, accusatory, started having panic attacks in social situations. He went from being very irritable, and untrusting to a sweet, thoughtful, animated person. It worked so well for him, when I had a bad day or pms, he would jokingly offer to share it with me. I liked the results it gave him. He did not have the problems that others have described when getting off the medication. He weaned off it over about 2-3 weeks and had no adverse effects. The important thing about these types of medication is to be open and honest with your doctor about how you feel. It will do you no good to hide your embarrasing symptoms, like decreased sex drive or mood swings or crying from your doctor. Sometimes these things are hard to talk about, but that is why you are paying him for his opinion.

column2: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am a yound college graduate and became exteremely depressed after graduation. I would cry all the time. I went on effexor and it did wonders for me-I am a whole new person. I gained 10 lbs the first month so I am switching to zoloft. If you are thin,  this is a great drug for you.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I was a basket of nerves with anxiety, and then suffered depression after my partner and I split. Started out on Effexor 37.5 and worked my way up gradually to 150 milligrams. It has calmed my anxiety to some degree ( I am a single mom to 7 children) and I am more patient with my boys. Depression syptoms lessened, but now I never cry and my emotions seem stifled. My sex life is non-existent as I have no libido and cannot orgasm. I tried going off of this drug for a couple of days so I could share maybe some intimate time with my partner, but withdrawal syptoms began, and I got a terrible headache, felt lost and anxious, and became nauseous. As soon as I took the pill I felt better. I want off of this drug, but am scared to quit. I saw just from that one day the consequences I faced for 2 missed doses. I almost wish I would've never taken this, or done more research on it first.

column9: I took Effexor over a 7 month period of time. My feeling of not being full is gone already but now I am experiencing a lot of dizziness, or head rushes constantly as a withdrawl from this medication which is why I am researching this further on this website. column2: susanvivii, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on Effexor XR for 3 months.   At first I took it at the 37.5 dose then I went to the 75 dosage and I could not handle the nausea, intense tightening of the neck, constipation, lack of appitite, sleepiness and vertigo. I have to take this medicine mid morning so that the "Yarning Effect" will not start until I get home.  I asked my doctor to just take be down to 37.5 and that has seemed to help.   I take this drug for PMDD.  My husband says that I am sweet otherwise but during this time I am really upset over small things and at times have very very negative thoughts.  I have read the side effects and read the comments prior to my taking the Effexor XR.  I now take the medicine every other day or as needed.  I know that it is supposed to be taken daily but if I take it daily even in the small dosages, I have Vertigo after about a week and have little emotion at all. When trying to go to a smaller dosage after about a week or 2 on the 75 dosage, I felt a bad shocking sensation in my head. This was alarming but I was glad to know that I was not the only one.  The medicine does help me with my over all mood and I don't get as anxious or concern about things as much as I used to.  I may be able to take this medicine like this due to the fact that I am a petite woman, I am not sure. I hope that the medicine works for you.

column2: alcat, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I took 300mg of EffexorXR for almost 4 years under a psych doc's care for depression.  Yes, it helped with libido, sex drive, very high energy.  I realized that over time my hours of sleep were decreasing, especially after the birth of my little one.  My moods were swinging way outer limits, I obsessed about huge global, national, and biblical superstorms.  I know that sounds crazy, and I was.  I checked myself into a mental unit at a local hospital two months after 9/11/2001.  I have seen several psychiatrists, I have been diagnosed with BPD.  I've had three episodes all while taking EffexorXR, which put me inpatient again.  I have now found a wonderful university hospital in the state I live in, the residents are brilliant.  I no longer am a victim to Effexor.  I'm  happy for those who have found solace with Effexor, but feel also heart-broken for those who have suffered its horrible long term usage, and the process to get off of it. Thank you for reading this, peace be upon you.

column2: brett88, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

Took only 2 days for sexual problems, and stopped taking it after 17 days.  Hard a bit to withdrawal.  I became almost like a zombie after awhile, though I played basketball and was much less achy and more flexible.

column2: pennsylvania76, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Effexor eliminated my symptoms of depression (crying spells, anxiety) within days, but the side effects kicked in within two weeks. I have night sweats (soaking the bed!), bloating and constipation (went through a full cycle of diagnostics for gall bladder disease -- all negative -- before realizing it could be the Effexor!), weight gain (5 lbs in 2 weeks), bloating, "hypoglycemia" episodes if I go too long without food, and the usual sexual side effects (have zero desire). I miss a pill about once a week, and rarely notice the withdrawal, so I'm now looking forward to getting off of this drug. I am going to try solar therapy, mood therapy and St. Johns Wort before going back on an SSRI.

column2: Edana, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I was given EffexorXR 300mg daily for Severe Depression five years ago. The only real effect I had from it was suicidal ideation! I was sent to a Psychiatrist who specializes in drug usage. He wanted me off the EffexorXR, but insisted I would have to spend 3-4 weeks in a psych ward to detox. I refused to go any place where I would be locked in, so he prescribed Wellbutrin along with the EffexorXR. I have multiple diseases, and daily take some 15 different drugs, including opiates for pain. I have been seeing this man for almost 5 years quarterly for scripts for a controlled med. I wanted off the Effexor, I beleived it was causing the Weight Loss,(130 lbs to 89lbs) Drooling, Hallucinationsand Nausea. He finally, after getting to know me, gave me a plan to teeter off the drug. I have been free of the capsules for 12 weeks, the first three weeks I barely remember. I am so glad to be off, my memory is better, and cognation is coming back!Edana

column2: MsN, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been on Effexor for approximately 4 years now. Overall I really have really liked this medication. It has had an impact on my life. I had social anxiety disorder as well as depression. Both of them were cleared up for a long time. Unfortunately, I burned out at my job last year and have ended up in the hospital for depression. I don't really want to say that my medication didn't work because I think I really caused my burnout (working 80+ hours/week, volunteering, etc.) My doctor bumped up my dosage from 150 to 225 and that seems to have helped me (along with a lot of therapy). Sometimes I am concerned though that maybe it is losing its effect on me. I hope not... I am not sure what I would change to. It was sort of rough in the beginning of taking this medication - I was hyper and it was harder to sleep. Those effects wore off after a couple of months. Now my side effects seem to include night sweats (sometimes the sheets are wet), weight gain (some, but it could just be that I am getting older), and my orgasms are different (its like I feel them through a filter). If I miss taking it for a few hours I feel vertigo and sort of out of body. Miss two days and I just quit moving. It sucks. I try to avoid that at all costs now :)Overall I am pleased with this medication. I was on Paxil before and all I felt like doing was stare at the wall.

fewer hot flashes, severe side effects!!!felt wired and restless, very nauseous, unable to sleep, and shaky. truthfully, i would rather have the hot flashes. i will not be finishing this drug. what the hell are these drug companies doing??????

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I experienced severe depression due to chronic pain.  After failing Lexapro, Paxil, and Cymbalta due to multiple side effects, my MD put me on Effexor. Although it did help w/ my crying spells and was able to get out of bed. Over a 7 month period of time I went from 120 lbs to 170 lbs !!! Now I'm depressed about about my extreme weight gain. I've never weighed this much in my life.  I've also had side effects such as amnesia, diff. concentrating, blurred vision, joint pain, abdominal bloating, and swelling all over.I'm getting off this med and would really think twice about having your MD starting you on it. Best of luck to all.

column2: Lisa, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)

I plan to test it, but will heed everyone's warning about the withdrawals.

column2: nomore, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)

column2: tmsl2, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I have mild depression; started Effexor XR 6 months ago; no side effects; take in evening about 2 hours before bed; has worked wonderfully for me. I do believe some of the depression is related to premenopause - I just turned 50.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I've been on Effexor XR 300mg/day for at least two years now (used Zoloft for years, have also been prescribed buproprion/wellbutrin, trazadone, zyprexa, gabitril).I like effexor because I had no side effects and it seemed to work well.  I felt a bit numb and still have some trouble concentrating and cannot hold extreme emotions for very long, but I think this drug is effective.  The negative is that the withdrawal symptoms SUCK.  Unfortunately this drug does not 'build up' in the system, so after 24 hours, you will definitely feel the missed dose.  I am miserable and won't even drive when I feel that way.  The worst part is that it makes me sleep, and not really wake up.  I've missed work, classes, etc.  If you are forgetful or cannot remember to take meds daily (missing more than 3 days a month), or even a little undisciplined (like me) I'd say don't do Effexor XR.  Once you take the missed dose, though, it kicks in a few hours later.  I'm looking to switch again, as I feel it does not work nearly as good as at the beginning of treatment (2+ years ago).

column2: nitak517, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: This is the most evil drug I've ever taken and it should be taken off the market. I'm only taking 75 mg. per day, so I can't imagine what it must be like for people that are taking higher does. Sure, it helped my anxiety/panic attacks and made me worry less, but it has made me forgetful, exhausted and at times, emotionless. I thnk now I don't worry ENOUGH. I have become a compulsive shopper and have completely lost interest in sex. I was always a very conscientious person at work and at home, but since taking this drug for over a year now, I have progressively become a slacker in every sense of the word. If I am even LATE by a few hours taking a dose, I begin having strange sensations and tremors all over my body and am extremely confused. My mouth jerks, I grind my teeth, I get so dizzy I can barely stand. I become paranoid and start to panic horribly. I am so angry that I was not warned that this drug was so life altering. I feel like a drug addict. I intend to start weaning off of it this weekend, but I'm very concerned about the withdrawal symptoms. If anyone reading this is considering taking this drug, DON'T DO IT!!

column2: 35-44 Male  (Patient)
column9: I have been using this medicine for approximately 3 years, a long time, I know.  It took quite a while to understand how it effected my body, and the proper times to take it, so that its side effects fit my schedule.  To avoid being tired, I started taking the medication at 5:00 AM (150mg) so that I could sleep for an hour after taking it, thereby avoiding the exhausted feeling mid-morning.  I take my other dose (150mg) at 10:00 PM, or right before bed.  IMPORTANT - Do not stop taking this medicine "cold turkey" and definitely talk to your doctor before you change the dosage.  Contrary to early studies, this drug has addictive properties that manifest themselves in the form of EXTREME vertigo.  I ran out of medicine for two days, by the morning of the third day, I could barely walk without weaving and bumping into things.  The emergency room doctor told me this was due to my abrupt change in dosage, and after a day of taking my medicine, I was fine.

column9: I am now on 150mg, after being reduced from 225mg.  Originally this drug worked out great for my depression, but after a few months it seemed to not work as well. column2: dutch waterman, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I was prescribed Effexor XR (150mg) which I took in conjunction with Zoloft (200mg) and valium (5mg x 3) to treat my depression and anxiety.  Initially I experienced benefits from the medication, but eventually these benefits were replaced by negative side-effecs which crippled me.  I gradually discontinued the Zoloft (against medical advice) and my health improved dramatically!  I continued to take the Effexor, although the therapeutic benefits diminished and I was plagued with dark, destructive and suicidal thoughts.  I decided to wean myself off of the Effexor (against doctor's advice again).  It took me about 2 months gradually reducing the dosage (sometimes increasing it again when withdrawal symptoms occurred).  Today I use only diazepam (5mg x 3) to control anxiety and panic.  My experience with prescription antidepressants is that the initial benefits diminish over time to be replaced by negative side-effects.  Effexor may be a good short-term therapy, but over time the side-effects increased and the benefits disappeared.  Diazepam in the only prescription that has provided consistent, continuous and effective treatment.

column2: cindy, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)

This was the 3rd one I tried before I had felt "myself" again. I believe everyone is different and not all medicines are for every-body

column2: Cindylou35, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had a dizzy episoede on the way to the gym, felt euphoric, then my heart raced, and my body went numb. I thought I was dying. The ambulance came all stats normal, blood sugar, blood pressure, ekg.  I finally felt ok after a while.  I thought it was from diest pills.  stayed dizzy for 2 weeks. Went to the doctor, he said it ws dizziness and gave me Anti-Vert for dizziness.  Another "attack came along" and back to dizzy again.  Hated it and stayed in bed for a week, was terrfified to get out of bed.  Went to another doctor.  Checked my thyroid and heart rate by wearing EKG for 24 hours.  Normal. Went to a ENT speacilast.  Then went through a dizziness battery test (ENG and audiology test) thougt it was an inner ear problem..Normal.  Went back to my normal doctor.  He said it was anxiety.  Put me on Ativant and Effexor XR 37.5 for a week then 75 mg.  Started to feel better.  First few nights couldn't sleep, but no major side effects.  Oh yeah, my pupils were huge fora week. It took like 5 weeks to begin working.  Had two more panic attacks in the 3rd week.  Scared it wouldn't work.  Used my emergency Ativant in case of these attacks.  Just went up to 150 mg.  Been on it for a week now at this dosage, and finally my dizziness is gone.  I feel great.  Im glad I was patient.  I was frustrated at first.  No weight gain and my relatinoships with others has improved. My mood swings are gone, anxiety about going to the gym is gone, and now I feel normal again.  I was scared I had a brain tumor due from the dizziness.  Guess it was anxiety and panic attacks after all.  Come to find out my sister and aunt have it too.  hereditary.  Anyways feel great now, JUST WATCH THE CAFFINE. IT WILL MAKE YOU FEEL AS IF YOU ARE HAVING AN ATTACK.  No more caffine for me. Anyways ..good luck.  A life saver!

column2: Jackie, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been taking Effexor XR for a long time, over 10 years, and this worries me.  It works very well, however, after taking it for so long I am starting to get very undesirable side effects - constant sweating, sore mouth with tongue getting cracks in it, like it was cut with a knife.  Thes side effects are bad enough that I wanted to stop taking Effexor.  I did for a while and replaced it with Wellbutrin, but that only helped with the depression.  It didn't help my headaches.  They came back.  I need more serotonin to take care of the headaches.

This medicine is Awful.  Been using about 7 months and suddenly I have been itching all over.  Made my blood pressure go up, so now I am on 3 different meds instead of 2.  Someone should be shot for making such a med.  My research shows that itching is a common side effect of this med. AND they say that it is not addicting, well explain to me why I have to be tapered off slowly.  I was taking 225 mg per day and for the last couple day down to 150mg.  Nausea, dizzy, etc. They also had me on Risperdal at bedtime, so I am going through withdrawals from that also.  If I ever get off this med.....no more for me.  Doctors should take it for a few months and then try to go off to experience the side affects.  I have had BAD headaches every since I started this stupid med.  I just pray to God that I can get off this med and stay off.  If you are going through similar side effects, I feel for you and understand.  Oh, by the way, I was on .25 of risperdal and they took me off cold turkey.  How can the FDA approve such mean drugs?!?!  I hope if you are trying to decide whether to take this drug or not, you do some serious research before deciding unlike me.  Now I am among the thousands of others who are trying to get off this and have a normal life.  Friends say "quit scratching" but you cannot quit.  I am taking benadryl to try to help with the itching.  Search effexor and itching on the net and see what you find.  STAY AWAY FROM THIS DRUG IF AT ALL POSSIBLE!  Good luck to all who are going through what I am and may God bles you all.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Effexor has worked well for me. At 150 mg, though, I have regular emotions, and I still get sad sometimes, but it's "normal" sad, emotions that I should be feeling.  It keeps me much more level and really functional.  It works great for me.

column2: MaggieMinn, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have to say this drug is great for depression and anxiety BUT...once you try to go off of it the withdrawl is similar to opiod/heroin/narcotic withdrawl. Unfortunatly I feel like I am going to be stuck on this medication for the rest of my life because the withdrawl is more than I can bare. I ended up going right back on the 75mg a day because nothing I did made me feel better once the drug was out of my system. I give the drug credit for its effectiveness in treating depression especially if you have tried other drugs and nothing has worked, but this is more of a long term treatment rather than a quick fix.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I already wrote a positive review of this drug, but after reading other reviews I thought I should add something about the withdrawal symptoms. To borrow from another reviewer...It's like your life is a slow motion movie. I start to get a little paranoid and VERY panicky. I am a little nervous about ever going off this medicine because of that. When I go off my pills, I feel completely out of it. Just remember that when starting treatment - this is not a drug to be taken only every few days.
