column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: While taking effexor xr, I have been able to attend class, I am a senior in college, and also go into public spaces without freaking out. I am on 150mg in the morning, since when I used to take it at bedtime I would not be able to sleep so now I take it in the morning. I also take xanax "as needed". I have not experienced any sexual side effects, and my appetite has not increased or decreased, just stayed steady and I have in fact lost weight with this med. I am moving up to 225mg, just to try and make it so I don't have "bad days" as often as I do now, which is about once a week. I used to take lexapro and with that I didn't want to have sex ever and gained weight like crazy. For me, effexor xr is great, the only bad thing is if I miss a dose I also have flu like symptoms, which involve a horrible upset stomach and dizziness, but it goes away after a day.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I used to be on lexapro an it didn't work for me. I have agoraphobia, which is a fear of open spaces, basically anywhere that is not my house, and with this it made it a little better, but nothing compared to the effexor xr. I am on 150mg before bed, and when i take it before bed, I can't sleep, so it was switched to the morning. Now that I take it in the morning, I have a regular sleep schedule, not so much a loss of appetite, but a steady one, and I have actually lost weight. My sex life is great, and has not been effected like it was when I was on the lexapro. With the effexor xr, I can leave my house to attend school, I'm a senior in college, and attending class is much easier, also grocery shopping is a breeze too. Overall, I am happy with my results, but it is being increased to 225mg a day to try and fix it more, since I do occasionally have bad mornings where I do not want to go outside.

column2: slushyboots, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on effexor XR for a month and a half now, and have just adjusted my dosage from 75mg/day to 150mg/day, I have found it very easy to use, NO nausea/tremors, and only experienced slight headaches/trouble sleeping but I had that anyway. I am trying to be patient so that I can have relief from depression, and not worry about what the drug is doing to me. It affects EVERYONE DIFFERENTLY so please don't be scared of what others report about THEIR side effects. If you find it doesn't help keep your mood steady and positive, try something else like adding therapy or cognitive behavioural therapy to your 'arsenal of support'  Do not go off effexor cold turkey, this is stated everywhere and many people ignore this warning, which causes problems. Warnings and directions are there for a reason and following the instructions can help you to have a more positive, healthy experience with anti-depressants. I hope this has been helpful for those of you considering effexor for depression/anxiety or whatever it may be for you, and know that ANY step toward getting help for yourself is a good one!! also, congrats for educating yourself first!  good luck everyone.

I had the usual side effects, brain zaps, etc.  But the emotional withdrawal symptoms is what is so devasting. column9: Effexor XR certainly helped my depression and lessened my desire to self-injure. However, like many others, I experience severe withdrawal symptoms if I miss a dose. I experience nausea, "brain shivers", crying and severe depression when I miss more than one dose. Also cannot have an orgasm (or a very weak one anyway). column9: This was the first anti-depressant treatment I tried for anxiety. I was taking Xanax at the same time. I had to stop taking Effexor as it caused central nervous system depression, which if you take this type of combination long enough it can be fatal from my research. I stopped the drug after two days. Symptoms of central nervous system depression include: extreme drowsiness, losing your balance, pains in the back of your head, extreme mobility problems, extreme state of confusion.The only anti-depressants I would recommend based on my own experience to be used with any of the benzodiazepines(xanax,klonopin,ativan,librium,etc .) would be Zoloft or Remeron(mirtazapine).

My Effexor treatment is supplemented with low dose Dexadrine. This is closely monitored by my MD. The help of Dexadrine is an often overlooked or underprescribed medication because of the unnecessarily fearful connection of the "speed" phenomenon - this is from a complete lack of education on the part of the MD as regards the usefulness of this medication, at proper times, to supplement the fatigue that can accompany depression.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
kellnk2, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I take Effexxor XR 75mg, once a day, as I have for about 5 years. 75mg is the lowest dosage. It seems to be relatively effective. I have full medical insurance, yet the cost to fill my Effexxor has never been less than $97.00. Personally, I find that overly expensive. Most importantly, I'd caution any and everyone considering taking Effexxor to research its side effects beforehand. Personally, I found the side effects to be nothing short of nightmarish. I 'm very regimented about taking my Effexxor every day at roughly the same time everyday. On the rare occassion that I missed a dose, let's say on a Tuesday morning; by Wednesday morning & CERTAINLY by Wednesday evening, I am completely nauseous, my equilibrium is totally off kilter, my pupils begin to dilate, then decrease down to the size of a "pin dot", and alternate back & forth until I am able to take my next dose. I become extremely dizzy, and was literally afraid to drive my car. The side effects are so fierce, that I have only missed a dose perhaps 3 times in 5 years. Even then, it was a result of me unexpectedly having to stay overnight out of town on business - or some other extinuating circumstance. I don't mean to be disparaging, I'm simply an advocate of self education re: psychotherapeutic meds because every person reacts differently to any drug & often times, physicians can't quite fathom the toll certain aspects of certain drugs have on our personal health and lifestyle.

column2: Jessie, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years
column9: I had a horrible time while I was on this medication.  My PCP put me on this right before I left home for college. I was on this medication for 2 years and if I missed a single dose, I would feel the withdrawal symptoms immediately.  I would have trouble walking, very unsteady (like I was 80 years old), extreme sensitivity to light and sound, nausea, weakness, tired all the time.  When I tried to stop taking the medication, I couldn't go more than 2 days even with 37.5 mg.  Finally, I just had to deal with the withdrawal symptoms and laid on a couch for a whole week until I was completely detoxed.  It was the worst experience of my life...and the medicine did nothing to help my "depression".  RESEARCH everything before you start taking something that you know nothing about.  Don't trust your doctor just because they went to medical school.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I take 300mg per day (2 pills of 150mg), which is 1 dose away from the most mg allowed to be prescribed by law.  If I do not take this medication EXACTLY 24 hours every day, immediately I start getting withdrawl symtoms. Being a recovered drug addict, I know it is much like a withdrawl from heroin. 1st is the migraines. Then the sweating, bones hurting, vomiting, diareah, it's horrible. But, that's how I never miss a dose. The more extreme symptoms I wrote about do not happen until the 1st full 24 hours without the medicine. But, nonetheless, I've been free from depression for 4 years now, and clean and sober for the same amount of time. i would recommend this product only if you plan to be on it for a LONG period of time, as you can tell what it will be like to try to get off of it.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Menopause took my sometimes edgy personality beyond the edge, and kept it hostage.  Any upset became fly off the handle blind anger.  This med stopped the derailment, totally and completely.  And immediately.  I still get angry, but it doesn't overtake me anymore.  I wish I could recapture the first two weeks on 39.5 mg; absolute contentment.  Doubling that did not much of anything; doubling it again (today) has been nice, but I still deal with being me.  I was afraid of meds like this; felt if I couldn't do it myself, I was weak and worthless.  Lemme tell ya, this med has made me ME again, to where I can interact with the world again instead of evading because I fear yet another inappropriate outburst.  I do like yakking with people; I am no longer sullen, which prevented that.  On the job, instead of finding fault with everything and anything, I've recaptured the joy in my ability to do what I do.  One idiot I work with, instead of being a source of bristling irritation, is just an idiot, period.  I still get angry and experience frustration; I'm still me.  But I don't find myself wanting to grab a baseball bat and knock some sense into people's heads anymore.  This med did not work for my biological daughter.  Can't judge meds like this that way.  But she did say it was nasty to get off of.  Weird positive side effect I've noticed:  when first taking, and at each dosage increase, my breathing is easier (I have asthma).  All in all, the positive of this med (no longer itching to jump out of my skin and whack somebody) is well worth it.  I watch the ceiling at night with each dose increase; when I do sleep, dreams are clearly remembered.  I am well pleased with this medication.  Me, who resisted messing with my psyche to the max for years.  If you're sitting on the fence, I'd say go ahead and jump in.  The water's fine.

column9: I was on Prozac for years, and the doctor wanted to try Effexor XR. Within four months, I was suicidal and totally withdrawn. My personal opinion is that the entire inventory of Effexor XR should be burned!

column2: sara, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year
column9: Ilost a sister 6mth later had open heart surgery and 4 mth later lost a friend and 4mth later lost my son witha blood clot 31 yr old I would say this was grief and depression and this drug put meaay from reality,I am off the drug ,and searching for a good grief counsellor take ativan occasionally

GRADUALLY MOVING UP TO THE DOSE MY DOCTOR WANTED ME TO TAKE WAS CRAZY...I FELT VERY FUNNY AND SAW TRACERS ALL DAY.  WHEN MY BODY ADJUSTED I WAS...OK...BUT GOD FORBID I NOT TAKE IT AT THE EXACT TIME OF DAY EACH DAY, OR I FELT AWFUL...FUZZY BRAIN FEELINGS, HEADACHES, IRRITABILITY, EYE PAIN...IT WAS TERRIBLE... AND WHEN I DECIDED TO GET OFF THE STUFF....IT TOOK ME ALMOST A MONTH TO GET THROUGH THE WITHDRAWAL SYMPTOMS....WHICH WERE THE SAME EXPLAINED BUT 100 TIMES WORSE...I COULD NOT SEE STRAIGHT NOR COULD I FUNCTION!!!! THIS DRUG WAS MADE SO YOU CAN NEVER GET OFF OF IT....IT IS AN AWFUL MEDICATION! I WOULD NEVER RECOMMEND IT TO ANYONE, AND IF YOU HAVE STARED, DEMAND SOMETHING ELSE TO YOUR DOCTOR.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year
column9: I take Effexor, Tegretol and Lamictal for Bipolar.  If I don't take one or the other my day is screwed.  They work perfectly together for me.  I feel complete and alive when I take my meds!
